quote: If you're not failing  you're not trying anything.
author: Woody Allen

quote: If you play it safe in life  you've decided that you don't want to grow anymore.
author: Shirley Hufstedler

quote: Those who try and fail are much wiser than those who never try for fear of failure.
author: Andre Bustanoby

quote: A man's life is interesting primarily when he has failed - I well know. For it's a sign that he tried to surpass himself.
author: Georges Clemenceau

quote: To avoid an occasion for our virtues is a worse degree of failure than to push forward pluckily and fall.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The fearful are caught as often as the bold.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Inaction  contrary to its reputation for being a refuge  is neither safe nor comfortable.
author: Madeleine Kunin

quote: They fail  and they alone  who have not striven.
author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

quote: You may be disappointed if you fail  but you are doomed if you don't try.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Failure is something made only by those who fail to dare  not by those who dare to fail.
author: Louis Binstock

quote: You don't always win your battles  but it's good to know you fought.
author: Marjorie Holmes

quote: The man who has done his level best  and who is conscious that he has done his best  is a success  even though the world may write him down a failure.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Many a man never fails because he never tries.
author: Norman MacEwan

quote: Life is very interesting  if you make mistakes.
author: Georges Carpentier

quote: When I have listened to my mistakes  I have grown.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: Mistakes and errors are the discipline through which we advance.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: A stumble may prevent a fall.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: It is defeat that turns bone to flint  it is defeat that turns gristle to muscle  it is defeat that makes men invincible. Do not then be afraid of defeat. You are never so near to victory as when defeated in a good cause.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Besides the practical knowledge which defeat offers  there are important personality profits to be taken. Defeat strips away false values and makes you realize what you really want. It stops you from chasing butterflies and puts you to work digging gold.
author: William M. Marston

quote: No experiment is ever a complete failure. It can always be used as a bad example.
author: Paul Dickson

quote: Failure is the foundation of success  and the means by which it is achieved.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: There is much to be said for failure. It is more interesting than success.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: Failure sometimes enlarges the spirit. You have to fall back upon humanity and God.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: It is often the failure who is the pioneer in new lands  new undertakings  and new forms of expression.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Let us not be needlessly bitter  certain failures are sometimes fruitful.
author: E. M. Cioran

quote: If I win several tournaments in a row  I get so confident I'm in a cloud. A loss gets me eager again.
author: Chris Evert Lloyd

quote: There's nothing that cleanses your soul like getting the hell kicked out of you.
author: Woody Hayes

quote: Failure is only an opportunity to begin again more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Disappointments are to the soul what the thunder-storm is to the air.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: The wisest person is not the one who has the fewest failures  but the one who turns failures to best account.
author: Richard R. Grant

quote: One of the advantages of defeat in life - maybe the main advantage - is that it provides an excuse for change. Defeat... invariably leads to new adventures.
author: James Reston

quote: Failure is God's own tool for carving some of the finest outlines in the character of his children.
author: Thomas Hodgkin

quote: I quit being afraid when my first venture failed and the sky didn't fall down.
author: Allen H. Neuharth

quote: What is defeat? Nothing but education  nothing but the first step to something better.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: From their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
author: Plutarch

quote: Having harvested all the knowledge and wisdom we can from our mistakes and failures  we should put them behind us and go ahead.
author: Edith Johnson

quote: I think success has no rules  but you can learn a great deal from failure.
author: Jean Kerr

quote: Failure is just another way to learn how to do something right.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: There are no mistakes  no coincidences. All events are blessings given to us to learn from.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: We will be victorious if we have not forgotten how to learn.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: It is the true nature of mankind to learn from mistakes  not from example.
author: Fred Hoyle

quote: The psychotherapist learns little or nothing from his successes. They mainly confirm him in his mistakes  while his failures  on the other hand  are priceless experiences in that they not only open up the way to a deeper truth  but force him to change his views and methods.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Failure ... is  in a sense  the highway to success  inasmuch as every discovery of what is false leads us to seek earnestly after what is true  and every fresh experience points out some form of error which we shall afterward carefully avoid.
author: John Keats

quote: We need to teach a highly educated person that it is not a disgrace to fail and that he must analyze every failure to find its cause. He must learn how to fail intelligently  for failing is one of the greatest arts of the world.
author: Charles F. Kettering

quote: There are no mistakes. The events we bring upon ourselves  no matter how unpleasant  are necessary in order to learn what we need to learn  whatever steps we take  they're necessary to reach the places we've chosen to go.
author: Richard Bach

quote: Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes.
author: John Dewey

quote: Failure is a school in which the truth always grows strong.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The important thing is to learn a lesson every time you lose.
author: John McEnroe

quote: It's good to fail now and again - you learn a lot more out of failure than you do out of success.
author: Ian Hunter

quote: One of the reasons mature people stop learning is that they become less and less willing to risk failure.
author: John W. Gardner

quote: Through failure  we learn a lesson in humility which is probably needed  painful though it is.
author: Bill W.

quote: A failure is a man who has blundered  but is not able to cash in the experience.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Like success  failure is many things to many people. With Positive Mental Attitude  failure is a learning experience  a rung on the ladder  a plateau at which to get your thoughts in order and prepare to try again.
author: W Clement Stone

quote: Disappointment is the nurse of wisdom.
author: Sir Boyle Roche

quote: When you make a mistake  don't look back at it long. Take the reason of the thing into your mind  and then look forward. Mistakes are lessons of wisdom. The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
author: Hugh White

quote: What can any of us do with his talent but try to develop his vision  so that through frequent failures we may learn better what we have missed in the past.
author: William Carlos Williams

quote: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: From the errors of others  a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Learn from the mistakes of others -  you can't live long enough to make them all yourself.
author: Martin Vanbee

quote: The entire history of science is a progression of exploded fallacies.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Don't use the conduct of a fool as a precedent.
author: Talmud

quote: Wise men learn by other men's mistakes  fools by their own.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: Learn to see in another's calamity the ills which you should avoid.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: A man is fortunate if he encounters living examples of vice  as well as of virtue  to inspire him.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: The line between failure and success is so fine that we scarcely know when we pass it  so fine that we are often on the line and do not know it.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: A series of failures may culminate in the best possible result.
author: Gisela Richter

quote: Failure is that early morning hour of darkness which precedes the dawning of the day of success.
author: Leigh Mitchell Hodges

quote: People fail forward to success.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: Apparent failure may hold in its rough shell the germs of a success that will blossom in time  and bear fruit throughout eternity.
author: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper

quote: The causes of mistakes are "I didn't know"  "I didn't think"  and "I didn't care."
author: Henry H. Buckley

quote: Failures are divided into two classes: those who thought and never did  and those who did and never thought.
author: John Charles Salak

quote: A failure establishes only this  that our determination to succeed was not strong enough.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Self-distrust is the cause of most of our failures. They are the weakest  however strong  who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
author: Christian Bovee

quote: Defeat is a thing of weariness  of incoherence  of boredom.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Failure at a task may be the result of having tackled it at the wrong time.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: We fail more often by timidity than by over-daring.
author: David Grayson

quote: Failure is more frequently from want of energy than want of capital.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Losers have tons of variety. Champions take pride in just learning to hit the same old boring winners.
author: Vic Braden

quote: Lack of will power has caused more failures than lack of intelligence or ability.
author: Flower A. Newhouse

quote: The word fate ... is the refuge of every self-confessed failure.
author: Andrew Soutar

quote: Half the things that people do not succeed in are through fear of making the attempt.
author: James Northcote

quote: The man who fails because he aims astray  or because he does not aim at all  is to be found everywhere.
author: Frank Swinnerton

quote: Half the failures in life come from pulling one's horse in when he is leaping.
author: A. W. Hare

quote: I cannot give you the formula for success  but I can give you the formula for failure: try to please everybody.
author: Herbert Bayard Swope

quote: If your project doesn't work  look for the part that you didn't think was important.
author: Arther Bloch

quote: Ninety-nine percent of the failures come from people who have the habit of making excuses.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: One who fears failure limits his activities.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The difference between failure and success is doing a thing nearly right and doing a thing exactly right.
author: Edward Simmons

quote: We have forty million reasons for failure  but not a single excuse.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: How to succeed: Try hard enough. How to fail: Try too hard.
author: Malcolm Forbes

quote: Most men fail  not through lack of education  but from lack of dogged determination  from lack of dauntless will.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: Failure comes only when we forget our ideals and objects and principles.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: An error is simply a failure to adjust immediately from a preconception to an actuality.
author: John Cage

quote: We are less likely to fail if we measure with judgement our chances and our capabilities.
author: Agnes Repplier

quote: Laziness is a secret ingredient that goes into failure. But it's only kept a secret from the person who fails.
author: Robert Half

quote: Failure is usually the line of least persistence.
author: Wilfred Beaver

quote: You can't expect to win unless you know why you lose.
author: Benjamin Lipson

quote: Most people don't plan to fail  they fail to plan.
author: John L. Beckley

quote: The ultimate umpire of all things in life is - fact.
author: Agnes C. Laut

quote: Losses are comparative  imagination only makes them of any moment.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: I would prefer even to fail with honor than win by cheating.
author: Sophocles

quote: Disillusion is a natural stage that follows the holding of an illusion.
author: Susan Shaughnessy

quote: If any good results to a man from believing a lie  it certainly comes from the honesty of his belief.
author: Margaret Collier Graham

quote: And what if I did run my ship aground  oh  still it was splendid to sail it!
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Success is a public affair. Failure is a private funeral.
author: Rosalind Russell

quote: It is not easy  but you have to be willing to make mistakes. And the earlier you make those mistakes  the better.
author: Jane Cahill Pfeiffer

quote: If you're gonna be a failure  at least be one at something you enjoy.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: Who would not rather flounder in the fight than not have known the glory of the fray?
author: Richard Hovey

quote: Better a false belief than no belief at all.
author: George Eliot

quote: A mistake is simply another way of doing things.
author: Katherine Graham

quote: The probability that we may fail in the struggle ought not to deter us from the support of a cause we believe to be just.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Three failures denotes uncommon strength. A weakling had not enough grit to fail thrice.
author: Minna Antrim

quote: Thou shouldst not decide until thou hast heard what both have to say.
author: Aristophanes

quote: All is fair in love and war.
author: English proverb

quote: What is sauce for the goose is sauce for the gander.
author: English proverb

quote: Nothing can be truer than fairy wisdom. It is as true as sunbeams.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: When the first baby laughed for the first time  the laugh broke into a million pieces  and they all went skipping about. That was the beginning of fairies.
author: Sir James Matthew Barrie

quote: Spirit is the real and eternal  matter is the unreal and the temporal.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Faith sees the invisible  believes the unbelievable  and receives the impossible.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: For the facts that make up the world need the non-factual as a vantage point from which to be perceived.
author: Ingeborg Bachmann

quote: Faith is nothing at all tangible. ... It is simply believing God  and like sight  it is nothing apart from its object. You might as well shut your eyes and look inside  and see whether you have sight  as to look inside to discover whether you have faith.
author: Hannah Whitall Smith

quote: Faith is the daring of the soul to go farther than it can see.
author: William Newton Clark

quote: Spirituality leaps where science cannot yet follow  because science must always test and measure  and much of reality and human experience is immeasurable.
author: Starhawk

quote: Some things have to be believed to be seen.
author: Ralph Hodgson

quote: Faith is like radar that sees through the fog-the reality of things at a distance that the human eye cannot see.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: Faith is to believe what we do not see  the reward of this faith is to see what we believe.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Because you cannot see him  God is everywhere.
author: Yasunari Kawabata

quote: Sorrow looks back  worry looks around  faith looks up.
author: Guideposts

quote: You have to believe in gods to see them.
author: Hopi Indian saying

quote: Faith declares what the senses do not see  but not the contrary of what they see.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Faith has to do with things that are not seen  and hope with things that are not in hand.
author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quote: Faith is the capacity of the soul to perceive the abiding ... the invisible in the visible.
author: Leo Baeck

quote: Deep faith eliminates fear.
author: Lech Walesa

quote: A red-hot belief in eternal glory is probably the best antidote to human panic that there is.
author: Phyllis Bottome

quote: Our faith triumphant o'er our fears.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Let nothing disturb you  nothing frighten you  all things are passing  God never changes.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: Fear imprisons  faith liberates  fear paralyzes  faith empowers  fear disheartens  faith encourages  fear sickens  faith heals  fear makes useless  faith makes serviceable.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: I knew without a glimmer of doubt that all things in the universe were connected by a living truth that would not relent its continuing search for wholeness until every form of life was united.
author: Lynn V. Andrews

quote: Unity  not uniformity  must be our aim. We attain unity only through variety. Differences must be integrated  not annihilated  not absorbed.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: By virtue of love is the lover transformed in the beloved and the beloved transformed in the lover.
author: Saint Angela of Foligno

quote: Spiritual love is a position of standing with one hand extended into the universe and one hand extended into the world  letting ourselves be a conduit for passing energy.
author: Christina Baldwin

quote: One's life has value so long as one attributes value to the life of others  by means of love  friendship  indignation and compassion.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Patience with others is Love  Patience with self is Hope  Patience with God is Faith.
author: Adel Bestavros

quote: God is universal  confined to no spot  defined by no dogma  appropriated by no sect.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Trying to do good to people without God's help is no easier than making the sun shine at midnight. You discover that you've got to abandon all your own preferences  your own bright ideas  and guide souls along the road our Lord has marked out for them. You mustn't coerce them into some path of your own choosing.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: All our acts have sacramental possibilities.
author: Freya Stark

quote: What loneliness is more lonely than distrust?
author: George Eliot

quote: As contagion of sickness makes sickness  contagion of trust can make trust.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: Faith in our associates is part of our faith in God.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: Those who trust us educate us.
author: George Eliot

quote: He who has no faith in others shall find no faith in them.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: Don't lose faith in humanity: think of all the people in the United States who have never played you a single nasty trick.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: You can't leave humanity out. If you didn't have humanity  you wouldn't have anything.
author: Alice Neel

quote: I plunged into the job of creating something from nothing. ... Though I hadn't a penny left  I considered cash money as the smallest part of my resources. I had faith in a living God  faith in myself  and a desire to serve.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: Faith in oneself... is the best and safest course.
author: Michelangelo

quote: Only the person who has faith in himself is able to be faithful to others.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: I never really look for anything. What God throws my way comes. I wake up in the morning and whichever way God turns my feet  I go.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: In order to experience everyday spirituality  we need to remember that we are spiritual beings spending some time in a human body.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: We must move from asking God to take care of the things that are breaking our hearts  to praying about the things that are breaking His heart.
author: Margaret Gibb

quote: Peace ... was contingent upon a certain disposition of the soul  a disposition to receive the gift that only detachment from self made possible.
author: Elizabeth Goudge

quote: You must never lose the awareness that in yourself you are nothing  you are only an instrument. An instrument is nothing until it is lifted.
author: Katheryn Hulme

quote: It's very reassuring and spiritual to be connected with something larger than yourself and the inside of your own head.
author: Joan Osborne

quote: With all this wide and beautiful creation before me  the restless soul longs to enjoy its liberty and rest beyond its bound.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: The country in which I live is not my native country  that lies elsewhere  and it must always be the center of my longings.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: The great majority of men use their own short-sighted ideas as a yardstick for measuring the divine omnipotence.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: Faith is the centerpiece of a connected life. It allows us to live by the grace of invisible strands. It is a belief in a wisdom superior to our own. Faith becomes a teacher in the absence of fact.
author: Terry Tempest Williams

quote: Faith doesn't wait until it understands  in that case it wouldn't be faith.
author: Vance Havner

quote: Your faith is what you believe  not what you know.
author: John Lancaster Spalding

quote: That's the thing about faith. If you don't have it you can't understand it. And if you do  no explanation is necessary.
author: Major Kira Nerys

quote: Our body is not made of iron. Our strength is not that of stone. Live and hope in the Lord  and let your service be according to reason.
author: Saint Clare of Assisi

quote: No  I don't understand my husband's theory of relativity  but I know my husband  and I know he can be trusted.
author: Elsa Einstein

quote: It is faith  and not reason  which impels men to action. ... Intelligence is content to point out the road  but never drives us along it.
author: Dr. Alexis Carrel

quote: Faith consists  not in ignorance  but in knowledge  and that  not only of God  but also of the divine will.
author: John Calvin

quote: Faith is an excitement and an enthusiasm  a state of intellectual magnificence which we must not squander on our way through life.
author: George Sand

quote: All the scholastic scaffolding falls  as a ruined edifice  before a single word: faith.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Some like to understand what they believe in. Others like to believe in what they understand.
author: Jerzy Lee Stanislaw

quote: Seek not to understand that thou mayest believe  but believe that thou mayest understand.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Faith is a sounder guide than reason. Reason can go only so far  but faith has no limits.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Logic is the key to an all-inclusive spiritual well-being.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: It is the heart which experiences God  and not the reason.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: There is no object that we see  no action that we do  no good that we enjoy  no evil that we feel  or fear  but we may make some spiritual advantage of all: and he that makes such improvement is wise  as well as pious.
author: Anne Bradstreet

quote: Faith is the continuation of reason.
author: William Adams

quote: If we were logical  the future would be bleak indeed. But we are more than logical. We are human beings  and we have faith  and we have hope.
author: Jacques Cousteau

quote: Faith is the art of holding on to things your reason has once accepted  in spite of your changing moods.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Reason is the triumph of the intellect  faith of the heart.
author: James Schouler

quote: Reason is our soul's left hand  Faith her right. By this we reach divinity.
author: John Donne

quote: It is as absurd to argue men  as to torture them  into believing.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Reason's voice and God's  Nature's and Duty's  never are at odds.
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: The way to see by Faith is to shut the eye of Reason.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Faith is believing what we cannot prove.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Faith is to believe what you do not yet see  the reward for this faith is to see what you believe.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Faith is believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.
author: Voltaire

quote: Faith is a higher faculty than reason.
author: Henry Christopher Bailey

quote: Faith is reason grown courageous.
author: Sherwood Eddy

quote: Faith is the result of the act of the will  following upon a conviction that to believe is a duty.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: So often we have a kind of vague  wistful longing that the promises of Jesus should be true. The only way really to enter into them is to believe them with the clutching intensity of a drowning man.
author: William Barclay

quote: Man makes holy what he believes  as he makes beautiful what he loves.
author: Ernest Renan

quote: You're not free until you've been made captive by supreme belief.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: It is by believing in roses that one brings them to bloom.
author: French proverb

quote: If you wish to strive for peace of soul and pleasure  then believe.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Loving is half of believing.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A faith that sets bounds to itself  that will believe so much and no more  that will trust so far and no further  is none.
author: Julius Charles Hare

quote: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Doubt is a necessity of the mind  faith of the heart.
author: Comtesse Diane

quote: For the truly faithful  no miracle is necessary. For those who doubt  no miracle is sufficient.
author: Nancy Gibbs

quote: My faith has wavered but has saved me.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Faith which does not doubt is dead faith.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: To believe with certainty  we must begin with doubting.
author: Stanislaus I

quote: In the midst of your doubts  don't forget how many of the important questions God does answer.
author: Verne Becker

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. Let us move forward with strong and active faith.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: It is impossible on reasonable grounds to disbelieve miracles.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: How desperately we wish to maintain our trust in those we love! In the face of everything  we try to find reasons to trust. Because losing faith is worse than falling out of love.
author: Sonia Johnson

quote: Faith is kind of like jumping out of an airplane at ten thousand feet. If God doesn't catch you  you splatter. But how do you know whether or not He is going to catch you unless you jump out?
author: Ann Kiemel

quote: Faith ... acts promptly and boldly on the occasion  on slender evidence.
author: John Henry Cardinal Newman

quote: Without risk  faith is an impossibility.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: If it wasn't for faith  there would be no living in this world  we couldn't even eat hash with any safety.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Living is a form of not being sure  not knowing what next  or how. The moment you know how  you begin to die a little. The artist never entirely knows. We guess. We may be wrong  but we take leap after leap in the dark.
author: Agnes de Mille

quote: Let us move on  and step out boldly  though it be into the night  and we can scarcely see the way. A Higher Intelligence than the mortal sees the road before us.
author: Charles B. Newcomb

quote: Faith is an assent of the mind and a consent of the heart  consisting mainly of belief and trust.
author: E. T. Hiscox

quote: The relation of faith between subject and object is unique in every case. Hundreds may believe  but each has to believe by himself.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Whether we name divine presence synchronicity  serendipity  or graced moment matters little. What matters is the reality that our hearts have been understood. Nothing is as real as a healthy dose of magic which restores our spirits.
author: Nancy Long

quote: Maybe the tragedy of the human race was that we had forgotten that we are each divine.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: We cannot hand our faith to one another. ... Even in the Middle Ages  when faith was theoretically uniform  it was always practically individual.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: Every human being is born without faith. Faith comes only through the process of making decisions to change before we can be sure it's the right move.
author: Dr. Robert H. Schuller

quote: I believe devoutly in the Word. The Word can save all  destroy all  stop the inevitable  and express the inexpressible.
author: Nina Voronel

quote: To believe in God is to yearn for His existence  and furthermore  it is to act as if He did exist.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: The principle part of faith is patience.
author: George Macdonald

quote: I've been readen th Bible an a hunten God fer a long while-off an on- but it ain't so easy as picken up a nickel off the floor.
author: Harriette Arnow

quote: In prayer one must hold fast and never let go  because the one who gives up loses all. If it seems that no one is listening to you  then cry out even louder. If you are driven out of one door  go back in by the other.
author: Jane Frances de Chantal

quote: Faith is not belief. Belief is passive. Faith is active.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: Can a faith that does nothing be called sincere?
author: Jean Racine

quote: He does not believe who does not live according to his belief.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: I pray hard  work hard  and leave the rest to God.
author: Florence Griffith Joyner

quote: All effort is in the last analysis sustained by faith that it is worth making.
author: Ordway Tweed

quote: It is for us to pray not for tasks equal to our powers  but for powers equal to our tasks  to go forward with a great desire forever beating at the door of our hearts as we travel towards our distant goal.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Faith is not something to grasp  it is a state to grow into.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Possessing faith is not convenient. You still have to live it.
author: Francoise Mallet-Joris

quote: Faith is a curious thing  It must be renewed  it has its own spring.
author: Gladys Taber

quote: However much we do to avoid them  we shall never lack crosses in this life if we are in the ranks of the Crucified.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: To disbelieve is easy  to scoff is simple  to have faith is harder.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: No faith is our own that we have not arduously won.
author: Havelock Ellis

quote: Faith is a living and unshakable confidence  a belief in the grace of God so assured that a man would die a thousand deaths for its sake.
author: Martin Luther

quote: It is only mercenaries who expect to be paid by the day.
author: Teresa of Avila

quote: Spirit is the real and eternal  matter is the unreal and the temporal.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Faith  to my mind  is a stiffening process  a sort of mental starch.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Faith is hidden household capital.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Faith is the soul riding at anchor.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Faith is ... knowing with your heart.
author: N. Richard Nash

quote: Faith is an attitude of the person. It means you are prepared to stake yourself on something being so.
author: Arthur M. Ramsey

quote: Faith  as an intellectual state  is self-reliance.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Faith is the subtle chain which binds us to the infinite.
author: Elizabeth O. Smith

quote: Faith is nothing but obedience and piety.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Faith is a theological virtue that inclines the mind  under the influence of the will and grace  to yield firm assent to revealed truths  because of the authority of God.
author: Adolphe Tanqueray

quote: Faith is the only known cure for fear.
author: Lena K. Sadler

quote: What's up is faith  what's down is heresy.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Faith is spiritualized imagination.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Faith is the final triumph over incongruity  the final assertion of the meaningfulness of existence.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Faith is an encounter in which God takes and keeps the initiative.
author: Eugene Joly

quote: Faith is that which is woven of conviction and set with the sharp mordant of experience.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Faith is a practical attitude of the will.
author: John MacMurray

quote: Faith is a total attitude of the self.
author: John Macquarrie

quote: Faith is nothing else than trust in the divine mercy promised in Christ.
author: Philipp Melanchthon

quote: Faith is the divine evidence whereby the spiritual man discerneth God  and the things of God.
author: John Wesley

quote: Faith is a passionate intuition.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Faith is a bridge across the gulf of death.
author: Edward Young

quote: Faith is a certitude without proofs ... a sentiment  for it is a hope  it is an instinct  for it precedes all outward instruction.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Faith is the proper name of religious experience.
author: John Baillie

quote: Faith is the soul's adventure.
author: William Bridges

quote: Faith is obedience  nothing else.
author: Emil Brunner

quote: Faith is the response of our spirits to beckonings of the eternal.
author: George A. Buttrick

quote: Faith is a knowledge of the benevolence of God toward us  and a certain persuasion of His veracity.
author: John Calvin

quote: Faith is loyalty to some inspired teacher  some spiritual hero.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Faith is God's work within us.
author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quote: To me  faith means not worrying.
author: John Dewey

quote: Faith is building on what you know is here  so you can reach what you know is there.
author: Cullen Hightower

quote: Faith is a gift of God which man can neither give nor take away by promise of rewards  or menaces of torture.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Faith is primarily a process of identification  the process by which the individual ceases to be himself and becomes part of something eternal.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Faith is the function of the heart.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Faith implies the disbelief of a lesser fact in favor of a greater.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The great act of faith is when a man decides that he is not God.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: Faith is the little night-light that burns in a sick-room  as long as it is there  the obscurity is not complete  we turn towards it and await the daylight.
author: Abbe Henri Huvelin

quote: Faith is the summit of the Torah.
author: Solomon ibn Gabirol

quote: Faith is an act of self-consecration  in which the will  the intellect  and the affections all have their place.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Faith is courage  it is creative  while despair is always destructive.
author: David S. Muzzey

quote: Faith is to believe in something not yet proved and to underwrite it with our lives: it is the only way we can leave the future open.
author: Lillian Smith

quote: Faith begins as an experiment and ends as an experience.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Faith is an act of a finite being who is grasped by  and turned to  the infinite.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Faith is not a storm cellar to which men and women can flee for refuge from the storms of life. It is  instead  an inner force that gives them the strength to face those storms and their consequences with serenity of spirit.
author: Sam J. Ervin

quote: Faith is putting all your eggs in God's basket  then counting your blessings before they hatch.
author: Ramona C. Carroll

quote: Faith is the force of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Faith is a kind of betting  or speculation.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Without faith  nothing is possible. With it  nothing is impossible.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: Not truth  but faith it is that keeps the world alive.
author: Edna Saint Vincent Millay

quote: Truth is simply whatever you can bring yourself to believe.
author: Alice Childress

quote: You can do very little with faith  but you can do nothing without it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: I believe in the immortality of the soul because I have within me immortal longings.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The opposite of having faith is having self-pity.
author: Og Guinness

quote: Out of the chill and the shadow  Into the thrill and the shine  Out of the dearth and the famine  Into the fullness divine.
author: Margaret Elizabeth Sangster

quote: Faith is necessary to victory.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Faith is that quality or power by which the things desired become the things possessed.
author: Kathryn Kuhlman

quote: Father! Blessed word.
author: Maria S. Cummins

quote: Faith assuages  guides  restores.
author: Arthur Rimbaud

quote: Far graver is it to corrupt the faith that is the life of the soul than to counterfeit the money that sustains temporal life.
author: Saint Thomas Aquinas

quote: I would rather live in a world where my life is surrounded by mystery than live in a world so small that my mind could comprehend it.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: We do not believe until we want a thing and feel that we shall die if it is not granted to us  and then we kneel and believe.
author: Frances Hodgson Burnett

quote: Writing a novel without being asked seems a bit like having a baby when you have nowhere to live.
author: Lucy Ellman

quote: I am living on hope and faith ... a pretty good diet when the mind will receive them.
author: Edwin Arlington Robinson

quote: Faith is the sturdiest  the most manly of the virtues. It lies behind our pluckiest... strivings. It is the virtue of the storm  just as happiness is the virtue of the sunshine.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: There is one inevitable criterion of judgment touching religious faith ... Can you reduce it to practice? If not  have none of it.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Strike from mankind the principle of faith  and men would have no more history than a flock of sheep.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Faith is one of the forces by which men live  the total absence of it means collapse.
author: William James

quote: Pity the human being who is not able to connect faith within himself with the infinite.... He who has faith has ... an inward reservoir of courage  hope  confidence  calmness  and assuring trust that all will come out well-even though to the world it may appear to come out most badly.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: Faith is a gift of God.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Through the dark and stormy night Faith beholds a feeble light Up the blackness streaking  Knowing God's own time is best  In a patient hope I rest For the full day-breaking!
author: John Greenleaf Whittier

quote: To win true peace  a man needs to feel himself directed  pardoned and sustained by a supreme power  to feel himself in the right road  at the point where God would have him be-in order with God and the universe. This faith gives strength and calm.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Faith may be relied upon to produce sustained action and  more rarely  sustained contemplation.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The person who has a firm trust in the Supreme Being is powerful in his power  wise by his wisdom  happy by his happiness.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: As your faith is strengthened you will find that there is no longer the need to have a sense of control  that things will flow as they will  and that you will flow with them  to your great delight and benefit.
author: Emmanuel

quote: The historic glory of America lies in the fact that it is the one nation that was founded like a church. That is  it was founded on a faith that was not merely summed up after it had exited  but was defined before it existed.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The only faith that wears well and holds its color in all weather is that which is woven of conviction.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The primary cause of unhappiness in the world today is ... lack of faith.
author: Carl Jung

quote: You do build in darkness if you have faith. When the light returns you have made of yourself a fortress which is impregnable to certain kinds of trouble  you may even find yourself needed and sought by others as a beacon in their dark.
author: Olga Rosmanith

quote: It is by faith that poetry  as well as devotion  soars above this dull earth  that imagination breaks through its clouds  breathes a purer air  and lives in a softer light.
author: Henry Giles

quote: Religious faith  indeed  relates to that which is above us  but it must arise from that which is within us.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: Faith enables persons to be persons because it lets God be God.
author: Carter Lindberg

quote: Faith makes the discords of the present the harmonies of the future.
author: Robert Collyer

quote: A person consists of his faith. Whatever is his faith  even so is he.
author: Hindu proverb

quote: In Israel  in order to be a realist  you must believe in miracles.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: Life without faith in something is too narrow a space in which to live.
author: George Lancaster Spalding

quote: Something will turn up.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Love means to commit oneself without guarantee  to give oneself completely in the hope that our love will produce love in the loved person. Love is an act of faith  and whoever is of little faith is also of little love.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Love one another and you will be happy. It's as simple and as difficult as that.
author: Michael Leunig

quote: Because God is love  the most important lesson He wants you to learn on earth is how to love.
author: Rick Warren

quote: Love is not blind - it sees more  not less. But because it sees more  it is willing to see less.
author: Julius Gordon

quote: Since love grows within you  so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
author: St. Augustine

quote: If you judge people  you have no time to love them.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Hatred paralyzes life  love releases it. Hatred confuses life  love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life  love illumines it.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Whenever you are confronted with an opponent  conquer him with love.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Time is too slow for those who wait  too swift for those who fear  too long for those who grieve  too short for those who rejoice  but for those who love  time is eternity.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: Nobody has ever measured  not even poets  how much the heart can hold.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quote: Tell me who admires and loves you  and I will tell you who you are.
author: Charles-Augustin Sainte-Beuve

quote: I have been astonished that men could die martyrs for their religion I have shudder'd at it. I shudder no more. I could be martyr'd for my religion Love is my religion And I could die for that. I could die for you.
author: John Keats

quote: Bitterness imprisons life  love releases it. Bitterness paralyzes life  love empowers it. Bitterness sours life  love sweetens it. Bitterness sickens life  love heals it. Bitterness blinds life  love anoints its eyes.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: No cord nor cable can so forcibly draw  or hold so fast  as love can do with a twined thread.
author: Robert Burton

quote: I believe that life is given us so that we may grow in love  and I believe that God is in me as the sun is in the color and fragrance of a flower.
author: Helen Keller

quote: There is only one path to Heaven. On Earth  we call it Love.
author: Karen Goldman

quote: Treasure the love you receive above all. It will survive long after your gold and good health have vanished.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Tis the most tender part of love  each other to forgive.
author: John Sheffield

quote: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love  prayer and forgiveness.
author: H. Jackson Brown

quote: Love blinds us to faults  hatred to virtues.
author: Moses Ibn Ezra

quote: Agape is disinterested love. . . . Agape does not begin by discriminating between worthy and unworthy people  or any qualities people possess. It begins by loving others for their sakes. . . . Therefore  agape makes no distinction between friend and enemy  it is directed toward both.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Do not waste time bothering whether you "love" your neighbor  act as if you did. As soon as we do this we find one of the great secrets. When you are behaving as if you loved someone  you will presently come to love him. If you injure someone you dislike  you will find yourself disliking him more. If you do him a good turn  you will find yourself disliking him less.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: We are obliged to love one another. We are not strictly bound to "like" one another.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: To love one's neighbors  to love one's enemies  to love everything - to love God in all His manifestations - human love serves to love those dear to us but to love one's enemies we need divine love.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Love is what we were borne with. Fear is what we learned here.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: The higher animals are in a sense drawn into Man when he loves them and makes them (as he does) much more nearly human than they would otherwise be.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: We're born alone  we live alone  we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: That best portion of a good man's life  His little  nameless  unremembered acts Of kindness and of love.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: A thing of beauty is a joy forever  Its loveliness increases  it will never Pass into nothingness.
author: John Keats

quote: God loves us the way we are  but too much to leave us that way.
author: Leighton Ford

quote: Though our feelings come and go  God's love for us does not.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times  and within reach of every hand.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: All wise people say the same thing  that you are deserving of love  and that it's all here now  everything you need. When you pray  you are not starting the conversation from scratch  just remembering to plug back into a conversation that's always in progress.
author: Anne Lamott

quote: Speak to me of love  said St Francis to the almond tree  and the tree blossomed.
author: Nicholas Kazantzakis

quote: Faith is the continuation of reason.
author: William Adams

quote: Faith is to believe what we do not see  and the reward of this faith is to see what we believe.
author: St. Augustine

quote: Faith is the substance of things hoped for  the evidence of things not seen.
author: Hebrews

quote: Let us have faith that right makes might  and in that faith  let us  to the end  dare to do our duty as we understand it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Here I stand. I can do no otherwise. God help me. Amen.
author: Martin Luther

quote: There lives more faith in honest doubt  Believe me  than in half the creeds.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

quote: Faith is the force of life.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: There is no such thing as white lies  a lie is as black as a coalpit  and twice as foul.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: False in one thing  false in everything
author: Law Maxim

quote: Falsehoods not only disagree with truths  but usually quarrel among themselves.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Adlai Stevenson - a Henry James character in a Reader's Digest world.
author: Cleveland Amory

quote: Glory is fleeting  but obscurity is forever.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Men are much more unwilling to have their weaknesses and their imperfections known than their crimes.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: One of the drawbacks of Fame is that one can never escape from it.
author: Nellie Melba

quote: Popularity is a crime from the moment it is sought  it is only a virtue where men have it whether they will or not.
author: Sir George Savile

quote: That sovereign of insufferables.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: The only man who wasn't spoilt by being lionized was Daniel.
author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

quote: The ordinary man casts a shadow in a way we do not quite understand. The man of genius casts light.
author: George Steiner

quote: Though familiarity may not breed contempt  it takes off the edge of admiration.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: When I pass my name in such large letters I blush  but at the same time instinctively raise my hat.
author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

quote: Fame is the sum of the misunderstanding that gathers about a new name.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
author: Voltaire

quote: Now when I bore people at a party  they think it's their fault.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: One must choose between Obscurity with Efficiency  and Fame with its inevitable collateral of Bluff.
author: William McFee

quote: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
author: Antonio Porchia

quote: After I am dead  I would rather have men ask why Cato has no monument than why he had one.
author: Cato the Elder

quote: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: The greatest monarch on the proudest throne is obliged to sit upon his own arse.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: All celebrated people lose dignity on a close view.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: A celebrity is a person known for his well-knownness. Celebrities intensify their celebrity images simply by being well known for relations among themselves. By a kind of symbiosis  celebrities live off each other.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Before such a prodigious career  judgement is torn between blame and admiration.
author: Charles de Gaulle

quote: Famous remarks are very seldom quoted correctly.
author: Simeon Strunsky

quote: It is strange how the memory of a man may float to posterity on what he would have himself regarded as the most trifling of his works.
author: William Osier

quote: To be somebody you must last.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: The world  like an accomplished hostess  pays most attention to those whom it will soonest forget.
author: John Churton Collins

quote: Public opinion: a vulgar  impertinent  anonymous tyrant who deliberately makes life unpleasant for any one of us who is not content to be the average man.
author: Dean William R. Inge

quote: Man's attitude toward great qualities in others is often the same as toward high mountains - he admires them but he prefers to walk around them.
author: Moritz Saphir

quote: All the fame I look for in life is to have lived it quietly.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: A celebrity is one who is known to many persons he is glad he doesn't know.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Fame is a bee It has a song - It has a sting - Ah  too  it has a wing.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: A sign of a celebrity is often that his name is worth more than his services.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: He that hath the name to be an early riser may sleep till noon.
author: James Howell

quote: Some day each of us will be famous for fifteen minutes.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: I awoke one morning and found myself famous.
author: Lord Byron

quote: To many fame comes too late.
author: Luis de Camoens

quote: If you would not be forgotten as soon as you are dead  either write things worth reading or do things worth writing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Fame is the perfume of heroic deeds.
author: Socrates

quote: Fame is but the breath of the people  and that often unwholesome.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: No true and permanent Fame can be founded except in labors which promote the happiness of mankind.
author: Charles Sumner

quote: What a heavy burden is a name that has become too famous.
author: Voltaire

quote: In fame's temple there is always a niche to be found for rich dunces  importunate scoundrels  or successful butchers of the human race.
author: Zimmermann

quote: Though familiarity may not breed contempt  it takes off the edge of admiration.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The living together for three long  rainy days in the country has done more to dispel love than all the perfidies in love that have ever been committed.
author: Arthur Helps

quote: He who has daughters is always a shepherd.
author: Old saying

quote: I am married to Beatrice Salkeld  a painter. We have no children  except me.
author: Brendan Behan

quote: I don't know who my grandfather was  I am much more concerned to know what his grandson will be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I have called the principle  by which each slight variation  if useful  is preserved by the term of Natural Selection.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: Mothers can get weaned as well as babies.
author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

quote: There are no illegitimate children - only illegitimate parents.
author: Leon R. Yankwich

quote: All happy families resemble one another  every unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The dark  uneasy world of family life - where the greatest can fail and the humblest succeed.
author: Randall Jarrell

quote: As a general thing  when a woman wears the pants in a family  she has a good right to them.
author: Josh Billings

quote: I am he As you are me And we are all together.
author: John Lennon

quote: Of all my wife's relations I like myself the best.
author: Joe Cook

quote: There is nothing like staying at home for real comfort.
author: Jane Austen

quote: When family relations are no longer harmonious  we have filial children and devoted parents.
author: R. D. Laing

quote: The family is the American fascism.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: The thing that impresses me most about North America is the way parents obey their children.
author: Edward, Duke of Windsor

quote: Who of us is mature enough for offspring before the offspring themselves arrive? The value of marriage is not that adults produce children but that children produce adults.
author: Peter de Vries

quote: Absence is one of the most useful ingredients of family life  and to do it rightly is an art like any other.
author: Freya Stark

quote: No matter how many communes anybody invents  the family always creeps back.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: There are fathers who do not love their children  there is no grandfather who does not adore his grandson.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Theodore Hesburgh

quote: Today  while the titular head of the family may still be the father  everyone knows that he is little more than chairman  at most  of the entertainment committee.
author: Ashley Montagu

quote: A mother's love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no aw  no pity  it dares all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Mother love has been much maligned. An over mothered boy may go through life expecting each new woman to love him the way his mother did. Her love may make any other love seem inadequate. But an unloved boy would be even more likely to idealize love. I don't think it's possible for a mother or father to love a child too much.
author: Frank Pittman

quote: Unconditional love is loving your kids for who they are  not for what they do ... it isn't something you will achieve every minute of every day. But it is the thought we must hold in our hearts every day.
author: Stephanie Marston

quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Where does the family start? It starts with a young man falling in love with a girl - no superior alternative has yet been found.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Of course if you like your kids  if you love them from the moment they begin  you yourself begin all over again  in them and with them.
author: William Saroyan

quote: You can see them alongside the shuffleboard courts in Florida or on the porches of the old folks' homes up north.... They are in love  they have always been in love  although sometimes they would have denied it. And because they have been in love they have survived everything that life could throw at them  even their own failures.
author: Ernest Havemann

quote: In family life  love is the oil that eases friction  the cement that binds closer together  and the music that brings harmony.
author: Eva Burrows

quote: In truth a family is what you make it. It is made strong  not by number of heads counted at the dinner table  but by the rituals you help family members create  by the memories you share  by the commitment of time  caring  and love you show to one another  and by the hopes for the future you have as individuals and as a unit.
author: Marge Kennedy

quote: [A mother] discovers with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: The Family is the Country of the heart. There is an angel in the Family who  by the mysterious influence of grace  of sweetness  and of love  renders the fulfillment of duties less wearisome  sorrows less bitter. The only pure joys unmixed with sadness.
author: Giuseppe Mazzini

quote: Smile at each other  smile at your wife  smile at your husband  smile at your children  smile at each other - it doesn't matter who it is and that will help you to grow up in greater love for each other.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: No man has ever lived that had enough of children's gratitude or woman's love.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: I take my children everywhere  but they always find their way back home.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Happiness is having a large  loving  caring  close-knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: The real question isn't whether or not you love your kids  but how well you are able to demonstrate your love and caring so that your children really feel loved.
author: Stephanie Marston

quote: The last step in parental love involves the release of the beloved  the willing cutting of the cord that would otherwise keep the child in a state of emotional dependence.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: So if you have a grandma  Thank the Good Lord up above  And give Grandmama hugs and kisses  For grandmothers are to love.
author: Lois Wyse

quote: Oh  I love to see a man with a cigar. It reminds me of my grandfather. Morning to night  he used to sit with a great big stogie dangling from his lips. Oh  the hours we kids used to spend sitting on his lap  playing with the yellow whiskers beneath his nose. Then he'd take out his teeth with the cigar still in them and chase us around the room! We'd all laugh and laugh . . . then suddenly Grampa's mood would change  and we'd all have to run for our lives. . . . You can't buy memories like that.
author: Daphne Frasier

quote: It is my pleasure that my children are free and happy  and unrestrained by parental tyranny. Love is the chain whereby to bind a child to its parents.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Perfect love sometimes does not come until the first grandchild.
author: Welsh proverb

quote: The reason grandparents and grandchildren get along so well is that they have a common enemy.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: The whole world is my family.
author: Pope John XXIII

quote: To us  family means putting your arms around each other and being there.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The family with an old person in it possesses a jewel.
author: Chinese saying

quote: Babies are such a nice way to start people.
author: Don Herold

quote: Each time a new baby is born there is a possibility of reprieve. Each child is a new being  a potential prophet  a new spiritual prince  a new spark of light precipitated into the outer darkness.
author: R. D. Laing

quote: Bringing a child into the world is the greatest act of hope there is.
author: Louise Hart

quote: Children are the world's most valuable resource and its best hope for the future.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Blessed be childhood  which brings down something of heaven into the midst of our rough earthliness.
author: Henri Amiel

quote: Children are the bridge to heaven.
author: Persian proverb

quote: We are given children to test us and make us more spiritual.
author: George Will

quote: One laugh of a child will make the holiest day more sacred still.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Children are the true connoisseurs. What's precious to them has no price - only value.
author: Bel Kaufman

quote: There are no seven wonders of the world in the eyes of a child. There are seven million.
author: Walt Streightiff

quote: Children  like animals  use all their senses to discover the world. Then artists come along and discover it the same way all over again.
author: Eudora Welty

quote: The only artists for whom I would make way are - children. For me the paintings of children belong side by side with the works of the masters.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Why  a four-year-old child could understand this report. Run out and find me a four-year-old child.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up - 'cause they're looking for ideas.
author: Paula Poundstone

quote: What do we teach our children? . . . We should say to each of them: Do you know what you are? You are a marvel. You are unique . . . You may become a Shakespeare  a Michelangelo  a Beethoven. You have the capacity for anything.
author: Pablo Casals

quote: By giving children lots of affection  you can help fill them with love and acceptance of themselves. Then that's what they will have to give away.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Teaching kids to count is fine  but teaching them what counts is best.
author: Bob Talbert

quote: It is infinitely more useful for a child to hear a story told by a person than by computer. Because the greatest part of the learning experience lies not in the particular words of the story but in the involvement with the individual reading it.
author: Frank Smith

quote: The parents exist to teach the child  but also they must learn what the child has to teach them  and the child has a very great deal to teach them.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: Grown men can learn from very little children for the hearts of little children are pure. Therefore  the Great Spirit may show to them many things which older people miss.
author: Black Elk

quote: Children have a remarkable talent for not taking the adult world with the kind of respect we are so confident it ought to be given. To the irritation of authority figures of all sorts  children expend considerable energy in "clowning around." They refuse to appreciate the gravity of our monumental concerns  while we forget that if we were to become more like children our concerns might not be so monumental.
author: Conrad Hyers

quote: Youth I Stay close to the young  and a little rubs off.
author: Alan Jay Lerner

quote: Those who love the young best stay young longer.
author: Edgar Friedenberg

quote: As long as I continue to hear "normal" people telling me I am too childish  I know I'm doing just fine.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: One of the most obvious facts about grownups to a child is that they have forgotten what it is like to be a child.
author: Randall Jarrell

quote: All of us collect fortunes when we are children. A fortune of colors  of lights  and darkness  of movement  of tensions. Some of us have the fantastic chance to go back to his fortune when grown up.
author: Ingmar Bergman

quote: So  like a forgotten fire  a childhood can always flare up again within us.
author: Gaston Bachelard

quote: The great man is he that does not lose his child-heart.
author: Mencius

quote: What God is to the world  parents are to their children.
author: Philo

quote: Honor your father and mother  even as you honor God  for all three were partners in your creation.
author: Zohar

quote: Remember  no matter how many candles you blow out this year  there's one gal who will always think of you as young  strong and handsome - your mother.
author: Susan D. Anderson

quote: There's no way to be a perfect mother and a million ways to be a good one.
author: Jill Churchill

quote: God could not be everywhere  therefore he made mothers.
author: Jewish saying

quote: Parents are often so busy with the physical rearing of children that they miss the glory of parenthood  just as the grandeur of the trees is lost when raking leaves.
author: Marcelene Cox

quote: The best inheritance a parent can give his children is a few minutes of his time each day.
author: O. A. Battista

quote: If I had known how wonderful it would be to have grandchildren  I'd have had them first.
author: Lois Wyse

quote: Few things are more delightful than grandchildren fighting over your lap.
author: Doug Larson

quote: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Of all the things which wisdom provides to make us entirely happy  much the greatest is the possession of friendship.
author: Epicurus

quote: Friendship is the only cement that will ever hold the world together.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: What a great blessing is a friend with a heart so trusty you may safely bury all your secrets in it.
author: Seneca

quote: When a friend is in trouble  don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Friendship improves happiness  and abates misery  by doubling our joy  and dividing our grief.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: It is not what you give your friend  but what you are willing to give him  that determines the quality of your friendship.
author: Mary Dixon Thayer

quote: A friend is someone who knows all about you and loves you just the same.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: It is not the talking that counts between friends  it is the never needing to say what counts.
author: Shawn Green

quote: True friendship comes when silence between two people is comfortable.
author: Dave Tyson Gentry

quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: To be a good friend remember that we are human magnets: that like attracts like and that as we give we get.
author: Wilfred Peterson

quote: Treat your friends as you do your pictures  and place them in their best light.
author: Jennie Jerome Churchill

quote: Friendships are fragile things  and require as much care in handling as any other fragile and precious thing.
author: Randolph Bourne

quote: Every man should have a fair-sized cemetery in which to bury the faults of his friends.
author: Henry Brooks Adams

quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends  never lose a chance to make them.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: You can make more friends in two months by becoming more interested in other people than you can in two years by trying to get people interested in you.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: It is great to have friends when one is young  but indeed it is still more so when you are getting old. When we are young  friends are  like everything else  a matter of course. In the old days we know what it means to have them.
author: Edvard Grieg

quote: Old friends are best. King James used to call for his old shoes  they were the easiest for his feet.
author: John Selden

quote: Each of us has a spark of life inside us  and our highest endeavor ought to be to set off that spark in one another.
author: Kenny Ausubel

quote: Sometimes our light goes out but is blown into flame by another human being. Each of us owes deepest thanks to those who have rekindled this light.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: There's no way that moving in with your parents is a sign that your life is on track.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: Cleaning your house while your children are still growing is like shoveling the walk before it stops snowing.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Insanity is hereditary  you get it from your children.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: The best way to keep children home is to make the home atmosphere pleasant -  and let the air out of the tires.
author: Dorothy Parker

quote: Happiness is having a large  loving  caring  close-knit family ... in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: Human beings are the only creatures on Earth that allow children to come back home.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Never brag about your ancestors coming over on the Mayflower  the immigration laws weren't as strict in those days.
author: Lew Lehr

quote: Whenever I'm with my [teenager]  I feel as though I have to spend the whole time avoiding land mines.
author: Amy Tan

quote: They are doing away with drive-ins. Now where are the teenagers going to go to not watch a movie?
author: Bob Thomas

quote: Big sisters are the crabgrass in the lawn of life.
author: Charles Schulz

quote: My son has taken up meditation - at least it's better than sitting doing nothing.
author: Max Kaufman

quote: In America there are two classes of travel -  first class and with children.
author: Robert Benchley

quote: The best thing to do is to behave in a manner befitting one's age. If you are sixteen and under  try not to go bald.
author: Woody Allen

quote: I think a dysfunctional family is any family with more than one person in it.
author: Mary Karr

quote: Family is just accident. . . . They don't mean to get on your nerves. They don't even mean to be your family  they just are.
author: Marsha Norman

quote: My father told me marijuana would cause me brain damage - because if he caught me doing it he was going to break my head.
author: Tom Dreesen

quote: We're supposed to take our problems to a family adviser. Personally  I've never met a family adviser. They're all off somewhere listening to dirty stories.
author: Robert Orben

quote: The reason grandparents and grandchildren get along so well is that they have a common enemy.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Have children while your parents are still young enough to take care of them.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Let's face it  there's lots of spoiled kids out there . . . because you can't spank Grandma.
author: Janet Anderson

quote: Family life got better and we got our car back -  as soon as we put "I love Mom" on the license plate.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: You know your children are growing up when they stop asking where they came from and refuse to tell you where they're going.
author: P. O'Brien

quote: I hate housework! You make the beds  you do the dishes - and six months later you have to start all over again.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: I don't want to say anything about my kids . . . but I go to PTA meetings under an assumed name!
author: Robert Orben

quote: The Jewish man with parents still alive is a fifteen-year-old boy and will remain a fifteen-year-old boy until they die.
author: Philip Roth

quote: Adolescence is when children start trying to bring up their parents.
author: Richard Armour

quote: Adults are just children who earn money.
author: Kenneth Branagh

quote: I read one psychologist's theory that said  "Never strike a child in your anger." When could I strike him? When he is kissing me on my birthday? When he's recuperating from measles? Do I slap the Bible out of his hand on Sunday?
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: My father never raised his hand to any one of his children - except in self-defense.
author: Fred Allen

quote: Ask your child what he wants for dinner only if he's buying.
author: Fran Lebowitz

quote: Never raise your hands to your kids. It leaves your groin unprotected.
author: Red Buttons

quote: Never lend your car to someone you've given birth to.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: We were so poor we had no hot water. But it didn't matter because we had no bathtub to put it in anyway.
author: Tom Dreesen

quote: In most states you can get a driver's license when you're sixteen years old  which made a lot of sense to me when I was sixteen years old but now seems insane.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Home is the place  when you have to go there  they have to take you in.
author: Robert Frost

quote: I love being a great-grandparent  but what I hate is being the the mother of a grandparent.
author: Janet Anderson

quote: I want you to know how I feel about my Italian heritage  so I'd like to say a few words in Italian: Verdi  Pavarotti  DiMaggio  Valentino  De Niro  Giuliani. . .
author: Susan Lucci

quote: I've just been to a debutant ball where all the girls were wearing low-cut gowns. It's clear why they're called coming out parties.
author: Martin Fenton

quote: Watching your daughter being collected by her date feels like handing over a million-dollar Stradivarius to a gorilla.
author: Jim Bishop

quote: Insanity runs in my family. It practically gallops.
author: Gary Grant

quote: The happiest moments of my life have been the few which I have passed at home in the bosom of my family.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: There is little less trouble in governing a private family than a whole kingdom.
author: Michel Montaigne

quote: None but a mule denies his family.
author: Moroccan proverb

quote: Fare thee well! and if for ever  Still for ever  fare thee well.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A farmer is always going to be rich next year.
author: Philemon

quote: Farming is a most senseless pursuit  a mere laboring in a circle. You sow that you may reap  and then you reap that you may sow. Nothing ever comes of it.
author: Joannes Stobaeus

quote: Those who labor in the earth are the chosen people of God  if He ever had a chosen people  whose breasts He has made His peculiar deposit for substantial and genuine virtue.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The farmer works the soil  The agriculturist works the farmer.
author: Eugene F. Ware

quote: Let us never forget that the cultivation of the earth is the most important labor of man. When tillage begins  other arts follow. The farmers  therefore  are the founders of civilization.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: A love of fashion makes the economy go round.
author: Liz Tilberis

quote: A pious man is one who would be an atheist if the king were.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Nothing is so hideous as an obsolete fashion.
author: Stendhal

quote: "The tradition of the new." Yesterday's avant-gard-experiment is today's chic and tomorrow's cliche.
author: Richard Hofstadter

quote: Art produces ugly things which frequently become beautiful with time. Fashion  on the other hand  produces beautiful things which always become ugly with time.
author: Jean Cocteau

quote: Be not the first by whom the new are tried  Nor yet the last to lay the old aside.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Fashion can be bought. Style one must possess.
author: Edna Woolman Chase

quote: Fashion  which elevates the bad to the level of the good  subsequently turns its back on bad and good alike.
author: Eric Bentley

quote: Even knowledge has to be in fashion and where it is not it is wise to affect ignorance.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: When a man is once in fashion  all he does is right.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Fashion condemns us to many follies  the greatest is to make oneself its slave.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Conformism is so hot on the heels of the mass-produced avant-garde that the 'ins' and the 'outs' change places with the speed of mach 3.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: There goes a man made by the Lord Almighty and not by his tailor.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Fashions fade - style is eternal.
author: Yves Saint Laurent

quote: And by my grave you'd pray to have me back So I could see how well you look in black.
author: Marco Carson

quote: A man of eighty has outlived probably three new schools of painting  two of architecture and poetry  and a hundred in dress.
author: Joyce Carey

quote: A fashionable woman is always in love - with herself.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Certainty generally is illusion and repose is not the destiny of man.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: How many roads must a man walk down Before you call him a man?
author: Bob Dylan

quote: Heaven is the place where the donkey finally catches up with his carrot: hell is the eternity while he waits for it.
author: Russell Green

quote: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Liane Cardes

quote: Everything passes  everything wears out  everything breaks.(Tout passe  tout lasse  tout casse.)
author: French proverb

quote: Whatso'er we perpetrate We do but row  we are steered by fate.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: Whatever the universal nature assigns to any man at any time is for the good of that man at that time.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Certain signs precede certain events.
author: Cicero

quote: See how the Fates their gifts allot. For A is happy - B is not. Yet B is worthy  I dare say  Of more prosperity than A.
author: W. S. Gilbert

quote: Destiny  n: a tyrant's authority for crime and a fool's excuse for failure.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Fate rules the affairs of mankind with no recognizable order.
author: Seneca

quote: He who does not desire or fear the uncertain day or capricious fate  is equal to the gods above and loftier than mortals.
author: Justus Lipsius

quote: The worst is not always certain but it's very likely.
author: French proverb

quote: It is a long road from conception to completion.
author: Moliere

quote: God keeps the wicked to give them time to repent.
author: Sophie Rostopchine Sigur

quote: Fortune is fickle and soon asks back what he has given.
author: Latin proverb

quote: Destiny is what you are supposed to do in life. Fate is what kicks you in the ass to make you do it.
author: Henry Miller

quote: That which God writes on thy forehead  thou wilt come to it.
author: The Koran

quote: When its time has come  the prey goes to the hunter.
author: Persian proverb

quote: The bow is bent  the arrow flies  The winged shaft of fate.
author: Ira Aldridge

quote: He has gone to the demnition bow-wows.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Thou must (in commanding and winning  or serving and losing  suffering or triumphing) be either anvil or hammer.
author: Goethe

quote: We make our fortunes and we call them fate.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Though men determine  the gods do dispose: and oft times many things fall out between the cup and the lip.
author: Robert Greene
