quote: Was it always my nature to take a bad time and block out the good times  until any success became an accident and failure seemed the only truth?
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Most human beings have an almost infinite capacity for taking things for granted.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: There are men who are happy without knowing it.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: We are all of us richer than we think we are.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: What a miserable thing life is: you're living in clover  only the clover isn't good enough.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: I am convinced  the longer I live  that life and its blessings are not so entirely unjustly distributed as when we are suffering greatly we are inclined to suppose.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

quote: Over a period of time it's been driven home to me that I'm not going to be the most popular writer in the world  so I'm always happy when anything in any way is accepted.
author: Stephen Sondheim

quote: It made me gladsome to be getting some education  it being like a big window opening.
author: Mary Webb

quote: Too much of a good thing can be wonderful.
author: Mae West

quote: A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive. Having been alive  it won't be so hard in the end to lie down and rest.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: In the country of the blind  the one-eyed man is king.
author: Michael Apostolius

quote: Be satisfied  and pleased with what thou art  Act cheerfully and well thou allotted part  Enjoy the present hour  be thankful for the past  And neither fear  nor wish  the approaches of the last.
author: Martial

quote: No one is satisfied with his fortune  or dissatisfied with his intellect.
author: Antoinette Deshouliere

quote: Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: God pardons like a mother  who kisses the offense into everlasting forgetfulness.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Good  to forgive  Best  to forget.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Bear and forbear.
author: Epictetus

quote: To err is human  to forgive  divine.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Forgive others often  yourself never.
author: Syrus

quote: It is manlike to punish but godlike to forgive.
author: Peter von Winter

quote: Fortune makes him fool  whom she makes her darling.
author: Sir Francis Bacon

quote: It is fortune  not wisdom  that rules man's life.
author: Cicero

quote: The bitter dregs of Fortune's cup to drain.
author: Homer

quote: Fortunes made in no time are like shirts made in no time  it's ten to one if they hang long together.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Men are seldom blessed with good fortune and good sense at the same time.
author: Livy

quote: Fortune and Love befriend the bold.
author: Ovid

quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
author: Sallust

quote: A sleeping fox counts hens in his dreams.
author: Russian proverb

quote: An amiable weakness.
author: R. B. Sheridan

quote: France  freed from that monster  Bonaparte  must again become the most agreeable country on earth. It would be the second choice of all whose ties of family and fortune give a preference to some other one  and the first choice of all not under those ties.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Ye sons of France  awake to glory! Hark! Hark! what myriads bid you rise! Your children  wives and grandsires hoary  Behold their tears and hear their cries!
author: Rouget de Lisle

quote: France always has plenty men of talent  but it is always deficient in men of action and high character.
author: Napoleon

quote: The cause of freedom is the cause of God.
author: Samuel Bowles

quote: A decent boldness ever meets with friends.
author: Homer

quote: It is not enough to succeed  a friend must fail.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: A friend in power is a friend lost.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Chance makes our parents  but choice makes our friends.
author: Jacques Delille

quote: Hope is a pleasant acquaintance  but an unsafe friend.
author: Thomas Chandler Haliburton

quote: Money can't buy friends  but you can get a better class of enemy.
author: Spike Milligan

quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
author: John Singer Sargent

quote: My heart is warm with the friends I make  And better friends I'll not be knowing  Yet there isn't a train I wouldn't take  No matter where it's going.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: A sympathetic friend can be quite dear as a brother.
author: Homer

quote: Friends are relatives you make for yourself.
author: Eustache Deschamps

quote: A good friend is my nearest relation.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The richer your friends  the more they will cost you.
author: Elizabeth Marbury

quote: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
author: Susan Ferrier

quote: It is easier to forgive an enemy than a friend.
author: Madame Dorothee Deluzy

quote: Man's best support is a very dear friend.
author: Cicero

quote: If you want an accounting of your worth  count your friends.
author: Merry Browne

quote: Best friend  my well-spring in the wilderness!
author: George Eliot

quote: I have lost friends  some by death ... others by sheer inability to cross the street.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: One who's our friend is fond of us  one who's fond of us isn't necessarily our friend.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: True friends ... face in the same direction  toward common projects  interests  goals.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Friends are a second existence.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: My helpless friend  your helplessness is the most powerful plea which rises up to the tender father-heart of God. You think that everything is closed to you because you cannot pray. My friend  your helplessness is the very essence of prayer.
author: O. Hallesby

quote: A decent boldness ever meets with friends.
author: Homer

author: La Rochefoucauld
