author: Jacob Braude

quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: When all else is lost  the future still remains.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: Tis the sunset of life gives me mystical lore  And coming events cast their shadows before.
author: Thomas Campbell

quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: I know of no way of judging the future but by the past.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: The present is great with the future
author: Baron von Leibnitz

quote: Trust no Future  howe'er pleasant! Let the dead Past bury its dead!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Go forth to meet the shadowy Future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Take therefore no thought for the morrow  for the morrow shall take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient unto the day is the evil thereof.
author: Matthew

quote: There was the Door to which I found no key  There was the Veil through which I might not see.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: There was a wise man in the East whose constant prayer was that he might see today with the eyes of tomorrow.
author: Alfred Mercier

quote: I believe the future is only the past again  entered through another gate.
author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quote: Till the sun grows cold  And the stars are old  And the leaves of the Judgment Book unfold.
author: Bayard Taylor

quote: There is but one good throw upon the dice  which is to throw them away.
author: Paul Chatfield

quote: By gaming we lose both our time and treasure - two things most precious to the life of man.
author: Owen Felltham

quote: Man is a gaming animal.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Keep flax from fire  youth from gaming.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: It [gaming] is the child of avarice  the brother of iniquity  and the father of mischief.
author: George Washington

quote: Business is more exciting than any game.
author: Lord Beaverbrook

quote: Divorce is a game played by lawyers.
author: Cary Grant

quote: Poetry is a mug's game.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The game isn't over until it's over.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: I never lost a game. I just ran out of time.
author: Bobby Layne

quote: Most ball games are lost  not won.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: The game of life is not so much in holding a good hand as playing a poor hand well.
author: H. T. Leslie

quote: The game is not worth the candle.
author: French proverb

author: French proverb

quote: A garden is a lovesome thing - God wot! Rose plot  Fringed pool  Fern grot -  The veriest school Of peace  and yet the fool Contends that God is not. -  Not God in gardens! When the sun is cool? Nay  but I have a sign! 'Tis very sure God walks in mine.
author: Thomas Edward Brown

quote: God the first garden made  and the first city Cain.
author: Abraham Cowley

quote: One is nearer God's heart in a garden Than anywhere else on earth.
author: Dorothy Frances Gurney

quote: The genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Genius  in truth  means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
author: William James

quote: Genius as such can neither be explained nor treated away  only  at times  its delay and inhibition and its perversion to destructive or self-destructive ends.
author: Erik Erikson

quote: Doing easily what others find is difficult is talent  doing what is impossible for talent is genius.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: It takes immense genius to represent  simply and sincerely  what we see in front of us.
author: Edmond Duranty

quote: Results! Why  man  I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Every man of genius is considerably helped by being dead.
author: Robert S. Lund

quote: In the republic of mediocrity  genius is dangerous.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: We define genius as the capacity for productive reaction against one's training.
author: Bernard Berenson

quote: Before I was a genius I was a drudge.
author: Ignace Jan Paderewski

quote: Genius develops in quiet places  character out in the full current of human life.
author: Goethe

quote: Men of genius are the worst possible models for men of talent.
author: Murray D. Edwards

quote: When a true genius appears in the world you may know him by this sign  that the dunces are all in confederacy against him.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Talent is that which is in a man's power  genius is that in whose power a man is.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: There is a thin line between genius and insanity. I have erased this line.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Improvement makes straight roads  but the crooked roads without improvement are roads of genius.
author: William Blake

quote: Geniuses are the luckiest of mortals because what they must do is the same as what they most want to do.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Everyone is a genius at least once a year  a real genius has his original ideas closer together.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: The mark of genius is an incessant activity of mind. Genius is a spiritual greed.
author: V. S. Pritchett

quote: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: Sometimes men come by the name of genius in the same way that certain insects come by the name of centipede - not because they have a hundred feet  but because most people can't count above fourteen.
author: G. C. Lichtenberg

quote: Too often we forget that genius ... depends upon the data within its reach  that Archimedes could not have devised Edison's inventions.
author: Ernest Dimnet

quote: There is no great genius without a mixture of madness.
author: Aristotle

quote: Genius is one per cent inspiration and ninety-nine per cent perspiration.
author: Thomas Alva Edison

quote: Genius does what it must  and talent does what it can.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Gift  like genius  I often think only means an infinite capacity for taking pains.
author: Ellice Hopkins

quote: Genius is a promontory jutting out of the infinite.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Three-fifths of him genius and two-fifths sheer fudge.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The lamp of genius burns quicker than the lamp of life.
author: Friedrich von Schiller

quote: The poet's scrolls will outlive the monuments of stone. The Genius survives  all else is claimed by death.
author: Edmund Spenser

quote: The gentleman is a Christian product.
author: George H. Calvert

quote: Once a gentleman  always a gentleman.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Propriety of manners and consideration for others are the two main characteristics of a gentleman.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: To make a fine gentleman  several trades are required  but chiefly a barber.
author: Oliver Goldsmith

quote: Let us put Germany  so to speak  in the saddle! you will see that she can ride.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: We Germans will never produce another Goethe  but we may produce another Caesar.
author: Oswald Spengler

quote: Act decidedly and take the consequences. No good is ever done by hesitation.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote: How lovely to think that no one need wait a moment  we can start now  start slowly changing the world!
author: Anne Frank

quote: To know what has to be done  then do it  comprises the whole philosophy of practical life.
author: Sir William Osier

quote: If you want to do something  do it!
author: Plautus

quote: Something must happen!
author: Heinrich Boll

quote: Putting off an easy thing makes it hard. Putting off a hard thing makes it impossible.
author: George Claude Lorimer

quote: Delay always breeds danger  and to protract a great design is often to ruin it.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The wise man does at once what the fool does finally.
author: Baltasar Gracian

quote: In putting off what one has to do  one runs the risk of never being able to do it.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Getting an idea should be like sitting down on a pin  it should make you jump up and do something.
author: E. L. Simpson

quote: Procrastination is opportunity's assassin.
author: Victor Kiam

quote: To do anything in this world worth doing  we must not stand back shivering and thinking of the cold and danger  but jump in and scramble through as well as we can.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The man who will not execute his resolutions when they are fresh upon him can have no hope from them afterwards  they will be dissipated  lost and perish in the hurry and scurry of the world  or sunk in the slough of indolence.
author: Maria Edgeworth

quote: Why always  "not yet"? Do flowers in spring say  "not yet"?
author: Norman Douglas

quote: The keen spirit seizes the prompt occasion.
author: Hannah Moore

quote: The hour is ripe  and yonder lies the way.
author: Virgil

quote: Delay not to seize the hour!
author: Aeschylus

quote: This one makes a net  this one stands and wishes. Would you like to make a bet which one gets the fishes?
author: Chinese rhyme

quote: Inspirations never go in for long engagements  they demand immediate marriage to action.
author: Brendan Francis

quote: If we really want to live  we'd better start at once to try.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: The rewards in business go to the man who does something with an idea.
author: William Benton

quote: The important thing is somehow to begin.
author: Henry Moore

quote: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

quote: As long as you can start  you are all right. The juice will come.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The way to get ahead is to start now.
author: William Feather

quote: Begin doing what you want to do now.
author: Marie Beynon Ray

quote: It is no good hearing an inner voice or getting an inner prompting if you do not immediately act on that inner prompting.
author: David Spangler

quote: Even if you're on the right track  you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The art of writing is the art of applying the seat of the pants to the seat of the chair.
author: Mary Heaton Vorse

quote: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Whenever you take a step forward  you are bound to disturb something.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: If you miss the first buttonhole  you will not succeed in buttoning up your coat.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: He who is outside the door has already a good part of his journey behind him.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: The beginning is half of every action.
author: Greek proverb

quote: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future  act now  without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The most important thing about getting somewhere is starting right where we are.
author: Bruce Barton

quote: Sometimes we look so intently toward the pinnacle that we stumble over the steps leading to it. Development begins just where you are.
author: Mrs. Herman Stanley

quote: Few begin with anything like a clear view of what they want to do  and the fortune they seek may come in a very different form from that which they have kept in view.
author: The Independent

quote: The most effective way to do it  is to do it.
author: Toni Cade Bambara

quote: Beginnings are apt to be shadowy.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: We will not know unless we begin.
author: Howard Zinn

quote: Let us watch well our beginnings  and results will manage themselves.
author: Alexander Clark

quote: You cannot contribute anything to the ideal condition of mind and heart known as Brotherhood  however much you preach  posture  or agree  unless you live it.
author: Faith Baldwin

quote: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Sally Berger

quote: To always be intending to live a new life  but never to find time to set about it  this is as if a man should put off eating and drinking and sleeping from one day and night to another  till he is starved and destroyed.
author: John Tillotson

quote: To choose is also to begin.
author: Starhawk

quote: Knowing is not enough  we must apply. Willing is not enough  we must do.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Wisdom is harder to do than it is to know.
author: Yula Moses

quote: Justice is a concept. Muscle is the reality.
author: Linda Blandford

quote: No one has a right to sit down and feel hopeless. There's too much work to do.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: Do noble things  do not dream them all day long.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: That is the principal thing: not to remain with the dream  with the intention  with the being in the mood  but always forcibly to convert it into all things.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Don't wait for your "ship to come in " and feel angry and cheated when it doesn't. Get going with something small.
author: Irene Kassorla

quote: Don't sit down and wait for the opportunities to come  you have to get up and make them.
author: Madame C. J. Walker

quote: The individual activity of one man with backbone will do more than a thousand men with a mere wishbone.
author: William J. H. Boetcker

quote: With mere good intentions hell is proverbially paved.
author: William James

quote: All the beautiful sentiments in the world weigh less than a single lovely action.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: It is vain to say human beings ought to be satisfied with tranquility: they must have action  and they will have it if they cannot find it.
author: George Eliot

quote: Now  go take on the day!
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: You can't steal second base and keep one foot on first.
author: Frederick B. Wilson

quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character  you must hammer and forge one for yourself.
author: James A. Froude

quote: What the Puritans gave the world was not thought  but action.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Stagnation is something worse than death. It is corruption  also.
author: William Gilmore Simms

quote: I myself must mix with action  lest I wither by despair.
author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

quote: Psychology is action  not thinking about oneself.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The great end of life is not knowledge  but action.
author: Thomas Henry Huxley

quote: The biggest sin is sitting on your ass.
author: Florynce Kennedy

quote: This is a world of action  and not for moping and droning in.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Honors and rewards fall to those who show their good qualities in action.
author: Aristotle

quote: Share the passion and action of your time  at peril of being judged not to have lived.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quote: The shortest answer is doing.
author: English proverb

quote: The end of man is action.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Optimism  unaccompanied by personal effort  is merely a state of mind  and not fruitful.
author: Edward L. Curtis

quote: To attain happiness in another world we need only to believe something  while to secure it in this world  we must do something.
author: Charlotte P. Gilman

quote: The only menace is inertia.
author: Saint John Perse

quote: One of the reasons why so few of us ever act  instead of react  is because we are continually stifling our deepest impulses.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Men expect too much  do too little.
author: Allen Tate

quote: Action may not always bring happiness  but there is no happiness without action.
author: William James

quote: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Act-act in the living present!
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Life is essentially a series of events to be lived through rather than intellectual riddles to be played with and solved.
author: George A. Buttrick

quote: There are risks and costs to a program of action. But they are far less than the long-range risks and costs of comfortable inaction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: What you don't do can be a destructive force.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: He that is overcautious will accomplish little.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Untilled ground  however rich  will bring forth thistles and thorns  so also the mind of man.
author: Therese of Lisieux

quote: Often greater risk is involved in postponement than in making a wrong decision.
author: Harry A. Hopf

quote: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: And all that you are sorry for is what you haven't done.
author: Margaret Widdemer

quote: Can anything be sadder than work unfinished? Yes  work never begun.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: The only things you regret are the things you didn't do.
author: Michael Curtiz

quote: Above all  try something.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: To avoid an occasion for our virtues is a worse degree of failure than to push forward pluckily and make a fall.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Indifference and inaction must always pay a penalty.
author: William Feather

quote: Shun idleness. It is a rust that attaches itself to the most brilliant metals.
author: Voltaire

quote: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act  but I do believe in a fate that falls on men unless they act.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: The real nature of an ethic is that it does not become an ethic unless and until it goes into action.
author: Margaret Halsey

quote: For it isn't enough to talk about peace. One must believe in it. And it isn't enough to believe in it. One must work at it.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Words are mere bubbles of water  but deeds are drops of gold.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: Ef women want any rights more'n dey got  why don't dey jes' take 'em and not be talkin' about it.
author: Sojourner Truth

quote: All talk of women's rights is moonshine. Women have every right. They have only to exercise them.
author: Victoria Claffin Woodhull

quote: Life is worth being lived  but not worth being discussed all the time.
author: Isabelle Adfani

quote: Action  not words  are the true criterion of the attachment of friends.
author: George Washington

quote: Words without actions are the assassins of idealism.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: If you have something to do that is worthwhile doing  don't talk about it ... do it.
author: George W. Biount

quote: If deeds are wanting  all words appear mere vanity and emptiness.
author: Greek proverb

quote: Talking is easy  action difficult.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: One's feelings waste themselves in words  they ought all to be distilled into action ... which bring results.
author: Florence Nightingale

quote: Boast not of what thou would'st have done  but do.
author: John Milton

quote: I like to deliver more than I promise instead of the other way around.
author: Dorothy Uhnak

quote: When I talked  no one listened to me. But as soon as I acted I became persuasive  and I no longer find anyone incredulous.
author: Giosue Borsi

quote: If you can talk brilliantly about a problem  it can create the consoling illusion that it has been mastered.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: Words gain credibility by deed.
author: Terence

quote: Men are alike in their promises. It is only in their deeds that they differ.
author: Moliere

quote: An acre of performance is worth a whole world of promise.
author: W. D. Howells

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Our chief defect is that we are more given to talking about things than to doing them.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: We have too many sounding words and too few actions that correspond with them.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Activity in back of a very small idea will produce more than inactivity and the planning of a genius.
author: James A. Worsham

quote: When it comes to getting things done  we need fewer architects and more bricklayers.
author: Colleen C. Barrett

quote: Get good counsel before you begin  and when you have decided  act promptly.
author: Sallust

quote: Ideas are one thing  and what happens is another.
author: John Cage

quote: Thinking about swimming isn't much like actually getting in the water. Actually getting in the water can take your breath away.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: All worthwhile men have good thoughts  good ideas and good intentions  but precious few of them ever translate those into action.
author: John Hancock Field

quote: A thought which does not result in an action is nothing much  and an action which does not proceed from a thought is nothing at all.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: To think is easy. To act is difficult. To act as one thinks is the most difficult of all.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Unless a capacity for thinking be accompanied by a capacity for action  a superior mind exists in torture.
author: Benedetto Croce

quote: Contemplation often makes life miserable. We should act more  think less  and stop watching ourselves live.
author: Nicolas de Chamfort

quote: What you theoretically know  vividly realize.
author: Francis Thompson

quote: We must not waste life in devising means. It is better to plan less and do more.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The best way to prepare for life is to begin to live.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Action will remove the doubt that theory cannot solve.
author: Tehyi Hsieh

quote: It is a common observation that those who dwell continually upon their expectations are apt to become oblivious to the requirements of their actual situation.
author: Charles Sanders Peirce

quote: He who deliberates fully before taking a step will spend his entire life on one leg.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: We don't have enough time to premeditate all our actions.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: The opportunity is often lost by deliberating.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: To think too long about doing a thing often becomes its undoing.
author: Eva Young

quote: Do not wait for ideal circumstances  nor the best opportunities  they will never come.
author: Janet Erskine Stuart

quote: Do what you can  with what you have  where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Anything worth doing is worth doing too soon.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: "Now" is the operative word. Everything you put in your way is just a method of putting off the hour when you could actually be doing your dream.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: Common sense does not ask an impossible chessboard  but takes the one before it and plays the game.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: I don't wait for moods. You accomplish nothing if you do that. Your mind must know it has got to get down to earth.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: My evil genius Procrastination has whispered me to tarry 'til a more convenient season.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

quote: I realize that if I wait until I am no longer afraid to act  write  speak  be  I'll be sending messages on a ouija board  cryptic complaints from the other side.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: He who postpones the hour of living is like the rustic who waits for the river to run out before he crosses.
author: Horace

quote: Being unready and ill-equipped is what you have to expect in life. It is the universal predicament. It is your lot as a human being to lack what it takes. Circumstances are seldom right. You never have the capacities  the strength  the wisdom  the virtue you ought to have. You must always do with less than you need in a situation vastly different from what you would have chosen.
author: Charlton Ogburn

quote: He who hesitates is last.
author: Mae West

quote: Conditions are never just right. People who delay action until all factors are favorable do nothing.
author: William Feather

quote: You decide you'll wait for your pitch. Then as the ball starts toward the plate  you think about your stance. And then you think about your swing. And then you realize that the ball that went past you for a strike was your pitch.
author: Bobby Murcer

quote: So what do we do? Anything. Something. So long as we just don't sit there. If we screw it up  start over. Try something else. If we wait until we've satisfied all the uncertainties  it may be too late.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: Everyone must row with the oars he has.
author: English proverb

quote: The question for each man is not what he would do if he had the means  time  influence and educational advantages  but what he will do with the things he has.
author: Frank Hamilton

quote: How many opportunities come along? If you wait for the right one  that's wrong  because it may never be right  and what have you got to lose? Even if it's a disaster  you've tried  you've learned something  you've had an adventure. And that doesn't mean you can't do it again.
author: Edward McCabe

quote: We should be taught not to wait for inspiration to start a thing. Action always generates inspiration. Inspiration seldom generates action.
author: Frank Tibolt

quote: If you wait for inspiration you'll be standing on the corner after the parade is a mile down the street.
author: Ben Nicholas

quote: The best place to succeed is where you are with what you have.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: One of these days is none of these days.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: Who waits until the wind shall silent keep Will never find the ready hour to sow.
author: Helen Hunt Jackson

quote: Begin somewhere  you cannot build a reputation on what you intend to do.
author: Liz Smith

quote: If you wait for the perfect moment when all is safe and assured  it may never arrive. Mountains will not be climbed  races won  or lasting happiness achieved.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: There is nothing to be gained by waiting for a better situation. You see where you are and you do what you can with that.
author: Jacob K. Javits

quote: It is in your act that you exist  not in your body. Your act is yourself  and there is no other you.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The things people discard tell more about them than the things they keep.
author: Hilda Lawrence

quote: The test of any man lies in action.
author: Pindar

quote: Every action we take  everything we do  is either a victory or defeat in the struggle to become what we want to be.
author: Anne Bronte

quote: It's where we go  and what we do when we get there  that tells us who we are.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: By his deeds we know a man.
author: African proverb

quote: A human being has no discernible character until he acts.
author: Constantine Nash

quote: What we make is more important than what we are  particularly if making is our profession.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: To do is to be.
author: Socrates

quote: You can't build a reputation on what you intend to do.
author: Liz Smith

quote: To be is to do.
author: Plato

quote: The way to do is to be.
author: Lao-Tzu

quote: The ordinary man is involved in action  the hero acts. An immense difference.
author: Henry Miller

quote: We judge ourselves by what we feel capable of doing  while others judge us by what we have already done.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Our deeds determine us  as much as we determine our deeds.
author: George Eliot

quote: The emotions are not always subject to reason ... but they are always subject to action. When thoughts do not neutralize an undesirable emotion  action will.
author: William James

quote: Silences have a climax  when you have got to speak.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: He who desires but acts not breeds pestilence.
author: William Blake

quote: When I am idle and shiftless  my affairs become confused  when I work  I get results ... not great results  but enough to encourage me.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: To be busy with material affairs is the best preservative against reflection  fears  doubts ... all these things which stand in the way of achievement. I suppose a fellow proposing to cut his throat would experience a sort of relief while occupied in stropping his razor carefully.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Acting can work a peculiar magic on the actor ... it can cure you (at least for the length of a performance) of a whole variety of ailments. Migraine headaches  miserable colds or toothaches will suddenly disappear as you're up there going through your paces.
author: Barbara Harris

quote: It is only when I dally with what I am about  look back and aside instead of keeping my eyes straight forward  that I feel these cold sinkings of the heart. But the first broadside puts all to rights.
author: Sir Walter Scott

quote: Action is the antidote to despair.
author: Joan Baez

quote: Action is the only reality  not only reality  but morality as well.
author: Abbie Hoffman

quote: Wishing does not make a poor man rich.
author: Arab proverb

quote: You can't get rich sitting on the bench.
author: Phil Linz

quote: Action makes more fortunes than caution.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: For purposes of action  nothing is more useful than narrowness of thought combined with energy of will.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: How  then  find the courage for action?... By accepting the human condition more simply and candidly  by dreading troubles less  calculating less  hoping more.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Necessity of action takes away the fear of the act.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Commitment leads to action. Action brings your dream closer.
author: Marcia Wieder

quote: One starts an action simply because one must do something.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: We couldn't possibly know where it would lead  but we knew it had to be done.
author: Betty Friedan

quote: You give but little when you give of your possessions. It is when you give of yourself that you truly give.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: I make presents to the mother  but think of the daughter.
author: Goethe

quote: Give an inch  he'll take an ell.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: He gives twice who gives quickly.
author: Publius Mimus

quote: Or what man is there of you  whom if his son ask bread  will he give him a stone?
author: Matthew

quote: I fear the Greeks  even when they bring gifts.
author: Virgil

quote: Behold  I do not give lectures or a little charity  When I give I give myself.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The paths of glory lead but to the grave.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Mine eyes have seen the coming of the glory of the Lord.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: O how quickly passes away the glory of the earth.
author: Thomas a Kempis

quote: One crowded hour of glorious life Is worth an age without a name.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Man proposes  and God disposes.
author: Ariosto

quote: God's in His Heaven -  All's right with the world!
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Fear that man who fears not God.
author: Abd-el-Kader

quote: Nearer  my God  to Thee - Nearer to Thee -  E'en though it be a cross That raiseth me  Still all my song shall be Nearer  my God  to Thee  Nearer to Thee!
author: Sarah Flower Adams

quote: I took a day to search for God  And found Him not. But as I trod By rocky ledge  through woods untamed  Just where one scarlet lily flamed  I saw His foot print in the sod.
author: Bliss Carman

quote: A picket frozen on duty  -  A mother starved for her brood -  Socrates drinking the hemlock  And Jesus on the rood  And millions who  humble and nameless  The straight  hard pathway trod  -  Some call it Consecration  And others call it God.
author: W. H. Carruth

quote: God moves in a mysterious way His wonders to perform  He plants his footsteps in the sea And rides upon the storm.
author: William Cowper

quote: God is incorporeal  divine  supreme  infinite Mind  Spirit  Soul  Principle  life  Truth  Love.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: An honest God is the noblest work of man.
author: Charles J. Ingersoll

quote: "We trust  Sir  that God is on our side." "It is more important to know that we are on God's side."
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: A mighty fortress is our God  A bulwark never failing  Our helper he amid the flood Of mortal ills prevailing.
author: Martin Luther

quote: Everyone is in a small way the image of God.
author: Marcus Manilius

quote: A God-intoxicated man.
author: Novalis

quote: He mounts the storm  and walks upon the wind.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: There is no respect of persons with God.
author: Romans

quote: If God be for us  who can be against us?
author: Romans

quote: The divine essence itself is love and wisdom.
author: Emmanuel Swedenborg

quote: God  the Great Giver  can open the whole universe to our gaze in the narrow space of a single lane.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Rock of Ages  cleft for me  Let me hide myself in thee.
author: Augustus Toplady

quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: If there were no God  it would be necessary to invent him.
author: Voltaire

quote: Give way to the Better if way to the Better there be  It exacts a full look at the Worst.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: The significance of a man is not in what he attains but rather in what he longs to attain.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second  that's what happens to you in life  I find.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: A successful individual typically sets his next goal somewhat but not too much above his last achievement. In this way he steadily raises his level of aspiration.
author: Kurt Lewin

quote: The most absurd and reckless aspirations have sometimes led to extraordinary success.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: All rising to great places is by a winding stair.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The only thing to know is how to use your neuroses.
author: Arthur Adamov

quote: Every ceiling  when reached  becomes a floor  upon which one walks as a matter of course and prescriptive right.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: We can always redeem the man who aspires and strives.
author: Goethe

quote: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: I have learned to have very modest goals for society and myself  things like clean air  green grass  children with bright eyes  not being pushed around  useful work that suits one's abilities  plain tasty food  and occasional satisfying nookie.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: If you would hit the mark  you must aim a little above it: Every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Ah  but a man's reach should exceed his grasp  or what's a heaven for?
author: Robert Browning

quote: Before we set our hearts too much upon anything  let us examine how happy they are  who already possess it.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: Ours is a world where people don't know what they want and are willing to go through hell to get it.
author: Don Marquis

quote: Those who aim at great deeds must also suffer greatly.
author: Plutarch

quote: It is a mistake to look too far ahead. Only one link in the chain of destiny can be handled at a time.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Do not wish to be anything but what you are  and try to be that perfectly.
author: St. Francis de Sales

quote: Winning isn't everything  but wanting to win is.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: It is no longer clear which way is up even if one wants to rise.
author: David Riesman

quote: Ambition is pitiless. Any merit that it cannot use it finds despicable.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Well is it known that ambition can creep as well as soar.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Make no little plans  they have no magic to stir men's blood . . . Make big plans  aim high in hope and work.
author: Daniel H. Burnham

quote: An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding.
author: Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis

quote: You have to have a dream so you can get up in the morning.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: What an immense power over the life is the power of possessing distinct aims. The voice  the dress  the look  the very motions of a person  define and alter when he or she begins to live for a reason.
author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

quote: If I had one wish for my children  it would be that each of them would reach for goals that have meaning for them as individuals.
author: Lillian Carter

quote: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach.
author: Benjamin Mays

quote: Purpose is what gives life a meaning.
author: C. H. Parkhurst

quote: Nothing contributes so much to tranquilize the mind as a steady purpose-a point on which the soul may fix its intellectual eye.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft Shelley

quote: The poor man is not he who is without a cent  but he who is without a dream.
author: Harry Kemp

quote: He is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
author: R. Briffault

quote: The great and glorious masterpiece of man is to know how to live to purpose.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Great minds have purposes  others have wishes.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Unless you give yourself to some great cause  you haven't even begun to live.
author: William P. Merrill

quote: If we could only give  just once  the same amount of reflection to what we want to get out of life that we give to the question of what to do with a two weeks' vacation  we would be startled at our false standards and the aimless procession of our busy days.
author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

quote: Be a life long or short  its completeness depends on what it was lived for.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: To live means to have ... a mission to fulfill-and in the measure in which we avoid setting our life to something  we make it empty.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: To seek one's goals and to drive toward it  steeling one's heart  is most uplifting!
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: The true worth of a man is to be measured by the objects he pursues.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A useless life is an early death.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: My father used to play with my brother and me in the yard. Mother would come out and say  "You're tearing up the grass." "We're not raising grass " Dad would reply. "We're raising boys."
author: Harmon Killebrew

quote: Without a purpose  nothing should be done.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: To grow and know what one is growing towards-that is the source of all strength and confidence in life.
author: James Baillie

quote: Our plans miscarry because they have no aim. When a man does not know what harbor he is making for  no wind is the right wind.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Every true man  sir  who is a little above the level of the beasts and plants  lives so as to give a meaning and a value to his own life.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Men cannot for long live hopefully unless they are embarked upon some great unifying enterprise  one for which they may pledge their lives  their fortunes and their honor.
author: C. A. Dykstra

quote: No pleasure philosophy  no sensuality  no place nor power  no material success can for a moment give such inner satisfaction as the sense of living for good purpose.
author: Minot Simons

quote: There is one thing which gives radiance to everything. It is the idea of something around the corner.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Lack of something to feel important about is almost the greatest tragedy a man may have.
author: Charles C. Noble

quote: There are three ingredients in the good life: learning  earning and yearning.
author: Christopher Morley

quote: If you cry "Forward " you must make plain in what direction to go.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Men  like nails  lose their usefulness when they lose direction and begin to bend.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: A novelist must know what his last chapter is going to say and one way or another work toward that last chapter. ... To me it is utterly basic  yet it seems like it's a great secret.
author: Leon Uris

quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.
author: Hannah More

quote: You must have long-range goals to keep you from being frustrated by short-range failures.
author: Charles C. Noble

quote: The world stands aside to let anyone pass who knows where he is going.
author: David Starr Jordan

quote: It is when things go hardest  when life becomes most trying  that there is greatest need for having a fixed goal. When few comforts come from without  it is all the more necessary to have a fount to draw on from within.
author: B. C. Forbes

quote: In everything one must consider the end.
author: Jean de la Fontaine

quote: A straight path never leads anywhere except to the objective.
author: Andre Gide

quote: There's some end at last for the man who follows a path  mere rambling is interminable.
author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.
author: E. J. Bartek

quote: The American people can have anything they want  the trouble is  they don't know what they want.
author: Eugene V. Debs

quote: Life has a meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: To have a reason to get up in the morning  it is necessary to possess a guiding principle. A belief of some kind. A bumper sticker  if you will.
author: Judith Guest

quote: An aspiration is a joy forever  a possession as solid as a landed estate  a fortune which we can never exhaust and which gives us year by year a revenue of pleasurable activity.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The soul that has no established aim loses itself.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Life has a value only when it has something valuable as its object.
author: George Hegel

quote: He turns not back who is bound to a star.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: He might never really do what he said  but at least he had it in mind. He had somewhere to go.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: The great and glorious masterpiece of man is how to live with a purpose.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: What most counts is not to live  but to live aright.
author: Socrates

quote: Choosing a goal and sticking to it changes everything.
author: Scott Reed

quote: No wind serves him who addresses his voyage to no certain port.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Laboring toward distant aims sets the mind in a higher key  and puts us at our best.
author: C. H. Parkhurst

quote: Everything's in the mind. That's where it all starts. Knowing what you want is the first step toward getting it.
author: Mae West

quote: We act as though comfort and luxury were the chief requirements of life  when all that we need to make us really happy is something to be enthusiastic about.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Unhappiness is in not knowing what we want and killing ourselves to get it.
author: Don Herold

quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: To have no set purpose in one's life is the harlotry of the will.
author: Stephen McKenna

quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Strong lives are motivated by dynamic purposes.
author: Kenneth Hildebrand

quote: One of the sources of pride in being a human being is the ability to bear present frustrations in the interests of longer purposes.
author: Helen Merrell Lynd

quote: Only he who can see the invisible can do the impossible.
author: Frank Gaines

quote: If you don't know where you are going  how can you expect to get there?
author: Basil S. Walsh

quote: The only people who attain power are those who crave for it.
author: Erich Kastner

quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: In this life we get only those things for which we hunt  for which we strive  and for which we are willing to sacrifice.
author: George Matthew Adams

quote: You seldom get what you go after unless you know in advance what you want.
author: Maurice Switzer

quote: Where no plan is laid  where the disposal of time is surrendered merely to the chance of incident  chaos will soon reign.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A life that hasn't a definite plan is likely to become driftwood.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: Only he who keeps his eye fixed on the far horizon will find his right road.
author: Dag Hammarskjold

quote: Fortunate is the person who has developed the self-control to steer a straight course toward his objective in life  without being swayed from his purpose by either commendation or condemnation.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Nothing is more terrible than activity without insight.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: If we would only give  just once  the same amount of reflection to what we want to get out of life that we give to the question of what to do with a two weeks' vacation  we would be startled at our false standards and the aimless procession of our busy days.
author: Dorothy Canfield Fisher

quote: The purpose of life is a life of purpose.
author: Robert Byrne

quote: The purpose of life is life.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: Goals are dreams with deadlines.
author: Diana Scharf Hunt

quote: So long as I believe I have to do certain things  I will just go right ahead. That's how I run my life.
author: Corazan Aquino

quote: A schedule defends from chaos and whim. It is a net for catching days. It is a scaffolding on which a worker can stand and labor with both hands at sections of time.
author: Annie Dillard

quote: You decide what it is you want to accomplish and then you lay out your plans to get there  and then you just do it. It's pretty straightforward.
author: Nancy Ditz

quote: What does so-called success or failure matter if only you have succeeded in doing the thing you set out to do. The doing is all that really counts.
author: Eva Le Gallienne

quote: Get out of the blocks  run your race  stay relaxed. If you run your race  you'll win. Channel your energy. Focus.
author: Carol Lewis

quote: Know what you want to do-then do it. Make straight for your goal and go undefeated in spirit to the end.
author: Ernestine Schumann-Heink

quote: There is a place in God's sun for the youth "farthest down" who has the vision  the determination  and the courage to reach it.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: Every man is said to have his peculiar ambition.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: We all live with the objective of being happy  our lives are all different  and yet the same.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Follow your bliss. Find where it is and don't be afraid to follow it.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: You can't assume the responsibility for everything you do-or don't do.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: There were angry men confronting me and I caught the flashing of defiant eyes  but above me and within me  there was a spirit stronger than them all.
author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quote: A woman finds the natural lay of the land almost unconsciously  and not feeling it incumbent on her to be guide and philosopher to any successor  she takes little pains to mark the route by which she is making her ascent.
author: Antoinette Brown Blackwell

quote: No matter what the competition is  I try to find a goal that day and better that goal.
author: Bonnie Blair

quote: It doesn't matter what anybody thinks of what I do. The clock doesn't lie.
author: Bonnie Blair

quote: You can have your titular recognition. I'll take money and power.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: Normal is not something to aspire to  it's something to get away from.
author: Jodie Foster

quote: I'm always making a comeback but nobody ever tells me where I've been.
author: Billie Holiday

quote: My passions were all gathered together like fingers that made a fist. Drive is considered aggression today  I knew it then as purpose.
author: Bette Davis

quote: In the multitude of middle-aged men who go about their vocations in a daily course determined for them much in the same way as they tie their cravats  there is always a good number who once meant to shape their own deeds and alter the world a little.
author: George Eliot

quote: Remember if people talk behind your back  it only means you're two steps ahead!
author: Fannie Flagg

quote: It's a sign of your own worth sometimes if you are hated by the right people.
author: Miles Franklin

quote: For me it's the challenge-the challenge to try to beat myself or do better than I did in the past. I try to keep in mind not what I have accomplished but what I have to try to accomplish in the future.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quote: There's a very fine line between a groove and a rut  a fine line between eccentrics and people who are just plain nuts.
author: Christine Lavin

quote: Promises that you make to yourself are often like the Japanese plum tree-they bear no fruit.
author: Frances Marion

quote: I am not sending messages with my feet. All I ever wanted was not to come up empty. I did it for the dough  and the old applause.
author: Fred Astaire

quote: First say to yourself what you would be  and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

quote: I can honestly say that I was never affected by the question of the success of an undertaking. If I felt it was the right thing to do  I was for it regardless of the possible outcome.
author: Golda Meir

quote: What exactly is success? For me it is to be found not in applause  but in the satisfaction of feeling that one is realizing one's ideal.
author: Anna Pavlova

quote: We can do whatever we wish to do provided our wish is strong enough. ... What do you want most to do? That's what I have to keep asking myself  in the face of difficulties.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: To be what we are  and to become what we are capable of becoming  is the only end of life.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: You have to define success in your own way. What maintains your dignity and integrity and what is your life's plan  where do you want to put your efforts. I could be richer and more famous  but I would have to give up things that are of infinitely more value.
author: Dr. Laura Schlessinger

quote: You cannot do good work if you take your mind off the work to see how the community is taking it.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: When the shriveled skin of the ordinary is stuffed out with meaning  it satisfies the senses amazingly.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Our victory is sure to come  and I can endure anything but recreancy to principle.
author: Lucy Stone

quote: If you just set out to be liked  you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time  and you would achieve nothing.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: Concentrate on finding your goal  then concentrate on reaching it.
author: Colonel Michael Friedman

quote: Enthusiasm for one's goal lessens the disagreeableness of working toward it.
author: Thomas Eakins

quote: I'm not going to let my life revolve around losing weight. I have other things to do.
author: Rosie O'Donnell

quote: The streams which would otherwise diverge to fertilize a thousand meadows  must be directed into one deep narrow channel before they can turn a mill.
author: Anna Jameson

quote: He who wants to do everything will never do anything.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: As you emphasize your life  you must localize and define it... you cannot do everything.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: There are people who want to be everywhere at once  and they get nowhere.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Leader and followers are both following the invisible leader-the common purpose.
author: Mary Parker Follett

quote: A windmill is eternally at work to accomplish one end  although it shifts with every variation of the weathercock  and assumes ten different positions in a day.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: People can have many different kinds of pleasure. The real one is that for which they will forsake the others.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Nations  like individuals  have to limit their objectives or take the consequences.
author: James Reston

quote: One of the most important factors  not only in military matters but in life as a whole  is ... the ability to direct one's whole energies towards the fulfillment of a particular task.
author: Field Marshal Erwin Rommel

quote: It is in self-limitation that a master first shows himself.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: One cannot manage too many affairs: like pumpkins in the water  one pops up while you try to hold down the other.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: One principle reason why men are so often useless is that they ... divide and shift their attention among a multitude of objects and pursuits.
author: Nathaniel Emmons

quote: I can tell you how to get what you want: You've just got to keep a thing in view and go for it and never let your eyes wander to right or left or up or down. And looking back is fatal.
author: William J. Lock

quote: He who begins many things finishes but few.
author: Italian proverb

quote: Who begins too much accomplishes little.
author: German proverb

quote: Never try to catch two frogs with one hand.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: If you run after two hares  you will catch neither.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The greyhound that starts many hares kills none.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: A bull does not enjoy fame in two herds.
author: Rhodesian proverb

quote: The man who seeks one thing in life  and but one May hope to achieve it before life be done. But he who seeks all things wherever he goes Only reaps from the hopes which around him he sows A harvest of barren regrets.
author: Owen Meredith

quote: He who wishes to fulfill his mission in the world must be a man of one idea  one great overmastering purpose  overshadowing all his aims  and guiding and controlling his entire life.
author: Julius Bate

quote: Firmness of purpose is one of the most necessary sinews of character and one of the best instruments of success. Without it  genius wastes its efforts in a maze of inconsistencies.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: A double-minded man is unstable in all his ways.... A determinate purpose in life  and a steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages  are indispensable conditions of success.
author: William M. Punshion

quote: If you would be Pope  you must think of nothing else.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: One should want only one thing and want it constantly. Then one is sure of getting it. But I desire everything  and consequently get nothing.
author: Andre Gide

quote: I care not what your education is  elaborate or nothing  what your mental calibre is  great or small  that man who concentrates all his energies of body  mind and soul in one direction is a tremendous man.
author: T. DeWitt Talmage

quote: He who hunts two hares leaves one and loses the other.
author: Japanese proverb

quote: He who serves two masters has to lie to one.
author: Portuguese proverb

quote: All animals except man know that the ultimate of life is to enjoy it.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: What does so-called success or failure matter if only you have succeeded in doing the thing you set out to do. The doing is all that really counts.
author: Eva Le Gallienne

quote: Catching something is purely a byproduct of our fishing. It is the act of fishing that wipes away all grief  lightens all worry  dissolves all fear and anxiety.
author: Gladys Taber

quote: Let us live  while we are alive!
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: Life is an end in itself  and the only question as to whether it is worth living is whether you have had enough of it.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: I take it as a prime cause of the present confusion of society that it is too sickly and too doubtful to use pleasure as a test of value.
author: Rebecca West

quote: There is no cure for birth and death save to enjoy the interval.
author: George Santayana

quote: Life is about enjoying yourself and having a good time.
author: Cher

quote: All men seek one goal: success or happiness.
author: Aristotle

quote: The goal of all civilization  all religious thought  and all that sort of thing is simply to have a good time. But man gets so solemn over the process that he forgets the end.
author: Don Marquis

quote: The business of life is to enjoy oneself  everything else is a mockery.
author: Norman Douglas

quote: The true object of human life is play.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: Pleasure is the object  duty and the goal of all rational creatures.
author: Voltaire

quote: I finally figured out the only reason to be alive is to enjoy it.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: Life exists for the love of music or beautiful things.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: There is only one meaning of life: the act of living itself.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: The main obligation is to amuse yourself.
author: S. J. Perelman

quote: I take it that what all men are really after is some form of  perhaps only some formula of  peace.
author: James Conrad

quote: There is no such thing as expecting too much.
author: Susan Cheever

quote: Your goal should be out of reach but not out of sight.
author: Anita DeFrantz

quote: Why should I deem myself to be a chisel  when I could be the artist?
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: I've always had such high expectations for myself. I'm aware of them  but I can't relax them.
author: Mary Decker Slaney

quote: I want to be great  or nothing. I won't be a commonplace dauber  so I don't intend to try any more.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: We're half the people  we should be half the Congress.
author: Jeannette Rankin

quote: I think the key is for women not to set any limits.
author: Martina Navratilova

quote: It's expectation that differentiates you from the dead.
author: Sheila Ballantyne

quote: The state of the world today demands that women become less modest and dream/plan/act/risk on a larger scale.
author: Charlotte Bunch

quote: Aim at the sun  and you may not reach it  but your arrow will fly far higher than if aimed at an object on a level with yourself.
author: J. Hawes

quote: When one paints an ideal  one does not need to limit one's imagination.
author: Ellen Key

quote: If you would hit the mark  you must aim a little above it  every arrow that flies feels the attraction of earth.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: People don't pay much attention to you when you are second best. I wanted to see what it felt like to be number one.
author: Florence Griffith Joyner

quote: Nearly every glamorous  wealthy  successful career woman you might envy now started out as some kind of schlepp.
author: Helen Gurley Brown

quote: The fact that I was a girl never damaged my ambitions to be a pope or an emperor.
author: Willa Cather

quote: Each time I leaped I seemed to touch the sky and when I regained earth it seemed to be mine alone.
author: Josephine Baker

quote: The tragedy of life doesn't lie in not reaching your goal. The tragedy lies in having no goal to reach. It isn't a calamity to die with dreams unfulfilled  but it is a calamity not to dream. It is not disgrace to reach the stars  but it is a disgrace to have no stars to reach for. Not failure  but low aim  is a sin.
author: Benjamin Mays

quote: I have an almost complete disregard of precedent and a faith in the possibility of something better. It irritates me to be told how things always have been done. ... I defy the tyranny of precedent. I cannot afford the luxury of a closed mind. I go for anything new that might improve the past.
author: Clara Barton

quote: It's not enough to just swing at the ball. You've got to loosen your girdle and really let it fly.
author: Babe Didrikson Zaharias

quote: I am comforted by life's stability  by earth's unchangeableness. What has seemed new and frightening assumes its place in the unfolding of knowledge.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Someday  someone will follow in my footsteps and preside over the White House as the President's spouse. And I wish him well.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: The most absurd and reckless aspirations have sometimes led to extraordinary success.
author: Vauvenargues

quote: When you reach for the stars  you may not quite get one  but you won't come up with a handful of mud  either.
author: Leo Burnett

quote: I might have been born in a hovel but I am determined to travel with the wind and the stars.
author: Jacqueline Cochran

quote: The brain is wider than the sky.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: My motto: sans limites.
author: Isadora Duncan

quote: A lot of young girls have looked to their career paths and have said they'd like to be chief. There's been a change in the limits people see.
author: Wilma Pearl Mankiller

quote: [My father] said  Don't grow up to be a woman  and what he meant by that was  a housewife ... without any interests.
author: Maria Goeppert Mayer

quote: Our being is subject to all the chances of life. There are so many things we are capable of  that we could be or do. The potentialities are so great that we never  any of us  are more than one-fourth fulfilled.
author: Katherine Anne Porter

quote: What else are we gonna live by if not dreams? We need to believe in something. What would really drive us crazy is to believe this reality we run into every day is all there is. If I don't believe that there's a happy ending out there-that will-you-marry-me in the sky-I can't keep working today.
author: Jill Robinson

quote: People think that at the top there isn't much room. They tend to think of it as an Everest. My message is that there is tons of room at the top.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: I am always more interested in what I am about to do than in what I have already done.
author: Rachel Carson

quote: We have believed-and we do believe now-that freedom is indivisible  that peace is indivisible  that economic prosperity is indivisible.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: I always ask the question  "Is this what I want in my life?"
author: Kathy Ireland

quote: Tell them that as soon as I can walk I'm going to fly!
author: Bessie Coleman

quote: He who demands little gets it.
author: Ellen Glasgow

quote: Unless in one thing or another we are straining toward perfection  we have forfeited our manhood.
author: Stephen McKenna

quote: It is necessary to try to surpass one's self always  this occupation ought to last as long as life.
author: Christina Augusta

quote: I was born to be a remarkable woman  it matters little in what way or how. ... I shall be famous or I will die.
author: Marie Bashkirtseff

quote: I never intended to become a run-of-the-mill person.
author: Barbara Jordaon

quote: There is only one real sin and that is to persuade oneself that the second best is anything but second best.
author: Doris Lessing

quote: Too low they build  who build beneath the stars.
author: Edward Young

quote: I have the same goal I've had ever since I was a little girl. I want to rule the world.
author: Madonna

quote: Your world is as big as you make it.
author: Georgia Douglas Johnson

quote: Whatever course you have chosen for yourself  it will not be a chore but an adventure if you bring to it a sense of the glory of striving  if your sights are set far above the merely secure and mediocre.
author: David Sarnoff

quote: Once you say you're going to settle for second  that's what happens to you.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Aim at heaven and you get earth thrown in  aim at earth and you get neither.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: I truly believe that before I retire from public office  I'll be voting for a woman for president.
author: Barbara Mikulski

quote: If I smashed the traditions it was because I knew no traditions.
author: Maude Adams

quote: Aim at perfection in everything  though in most things it is unattainable. However they who aim at it  and persevere  will come much nearer to it than those whose laziness and despondency make them give it up as unattainable.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: One may miss the mark by aiming too high  as too low.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss it  you will land among the stars.
author: Les Brown

quote: Life is a petty thing unless it is moved by the indomitable urge to extend its boundaries.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Far away in the sunshine are my highest inspirations. I many not reach them  but I can look up and see the beauty  believe in them and try to follow where they lead.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: A man's worth is no greater than the worth of his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Not failure  but low aim  is crime.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: On the human chessboard  all moves are possible.
author: Miriam Schiff

quote: Great is the road I climb  but... the garland offered by an easier effort is not worth the gathering.
author: Propertius

quote: I never took a position we were going to be a good ball club. I took the position we were going to be a winning ball club.
author: Red Auerbach

quote: Man's reach should exceed his grasp  or what's a heaven for?
author: Robert Browning

quote: Before you begin a thing  remind yourself that difficulties and delays quite impossible to foresee are ahead. ... You can only see one thing clearly and that is your goal. Form a mental vision of that and cling to it through thick and thin.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: You have to erect a fence and say  "Okay  scale this."
author: Linda Ronstadt

quote: You can change your beliefs so they empower your dreams and desires. Create a strong belief in yourself and what you want.
author: Marcia Wieder

quote: Man can only receive what he sees himself receiving.
author: Florence Scovel Shinn

quote: A person can grow only as much as his horizon allows.
author: John Powell

quote: You must learn day by day  year by year  to broaden your horizon. The more things you love  the more you are interested in  the more you enjoy  the more you are indignant about  the more you have left when anything happens.
author: Ethel Barrymore

quote: Enjoyment is not a goal  it is a feeling that accompanies important ongoing activity.
author: Paul Goodman

quote: What our deepest self craves is not mere enjoyment  but some supreme purpose that will enlist all our powers and give unity and direction to our life.
author: Henry J. Golding

quote: The very first condition of lasting happiness is that a life should be full of purpose  aiming at something outside self.
author: Hugh Black

quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
author: John Mason Brown

quote: There is more to life than just existing and having a pleasant time.
author: J. C. F. von Schiller

quote: Happiness is not the end of life  character is.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: A good goal is like a strenuous exercise-it makes you stretch.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: It's weak and despicable to go on wanting things and not trying to get them.
author: Joanna Field

quote: Growth is not concerned with itself.
author: Meridel Le Sueur

quote: The self-confidence one builds from achieving difficult things and accomplishing goals is the most beautiful thing of all.
author: Madonna

quote: If ambition doesn't hurt you  you haven't got it.
author: Kathleen Norris

quote: We need to restore the full meaning of that old word  duty. It is the other side of rights.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: That is happiness: to be dissolved into something completely great.
author: Willa Cather

quote: I looked on child rearing not only as a work of love and duty but as a profession that was fully as interesting and challenging as any honorable profession in the world and one that demanded the best I could bring to it.
author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

quote: Human happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
author: George Washington

quote: The measure of a life  after all  is not its duration  but its donation.
author: Corrie ten Boom

quote: When we ... devote ourselves to the strict and unsparing performance of duty  ihen happiness comes of itself.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: Duties are what make life most worth living. Lacking them  you are not necessary to anyone.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Seek happiness for its own sake  and you will not find it  seek for duty  and happiness will follow  as the shadow comes with the sunshine.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: True happiness ... is not attained through self-gratification  but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The only true happiness comes from squandering ourselves for a purpose.
author: William Cowper

quote: True happiness  we are told  consists in getting out of one's self  but the point is not only to get out  you must stay out  and to stay out  you must have some absorbing errand.
author: Henry James

quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: The happiest excitement in life is to be convinced that one is fighting for all one is worth on behalf of some clearly seen and deeply felt good.
author: Ruth Benedict

quote: The secret of living is to find ... the pivot of a concept on which you can make your stand.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The only ones among you who will be really happy are those who will have sought and found how to serve.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: He who never sacrificed a present to a future good  or a personal to a general one  can speak of happiness only as the blind speak of color.
author: Horace Mann

quote: There is no happiness except in the realization that we have accomplished something.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The full-grown modern human being ... is conscious of touching the highest pinnacle of fulfillment... when he is consumed in the service of an idea  in the conquest of the goal pursued.
author: R. Briffault

quote: Happiness is essentially a state of going somewhere  wholeheartedly  one-directionally  without regret or reservation.
author: William H. Sheldon

quote: A man's happiness: to do the things proper to man.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Happy the man who knows his duties!
author: Christian Furchtegott Gellert

quote: I believe half the unhappiness in life comes from people being afraid to go straight at things.
author: William J. Locke

quote: Happiness is the overcoming of not unknown obstacles toward a known goal.
author: L. Ron Hubbard

quote: Having a goal is a state of happiness.
author: E. J. Bartek

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quote: Without duty  life is soft and boneless.
author: Joseph Joubert

quote: Never mind your happiness  do your duty.
author: Will Durant

quote: I probably hold the distinction of being one movie star who  by all laws of logic  should never have made it. At each stage of my career  I lacked the experience.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: The man who succeeds above his fellows is the one who early in life discerns his object and toward that object habitually directs his powers. Even genius itself is but fine observation strengthened by fixity of purpose.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

quote: A determinate purpose of life  and steady adhesion to it through all disadvantages  are indispensable conditions of success.
author: William M. Punshion

quote: The secret of success is constancy to purpose.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The man who fails because he aims astray  or because he does not aim at all  is to be found everywhere.
author: Frank Swinnerton

quote: Life has ... taught me not to expect success to be the inevitable result of my endeavors. She taught me to seek sustenance from the endeavor itself  but to leave the result to God.
author: Alan Paton

quote: The object of war is not to die for your country  but to make the other bastard die for his.
author: General George S. Patton

quote: The object of war is to survive it.
author: John Irving

quote: If we want a free and peaceful world  if we want to make the deserts bloom and man grow to greater dignity as a human being-we can do it.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The most comprehensive formulation of therapeutic goals is the striving for wholeheartedness: to be without pretense  to be emotionally sincere  to be able to put the whole of oneself into one's feelings  one's work  one's beliefs.
author: Karen Horney

quote: I think the purpose of life is to be useful  to be responsible  to be honorable  to be compassionate. It is  after all  to matter: to count  to stand for something  to have made some difference that you lived at all.
author: Leo C. Rosten

quote: Only when men are connected to large  universal goals are they really happy-and one result of their happiness is a rush of creative activity.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: The great business of life is to be  to do  to do without  and to depart.
author: John Morley

quote: The proper function of man is to live-not to exist.
author: Jack London

quote: Life's objective is life itself.
author: Johann von Goethe

quote: I seek the utmost pleasure and the least pain.
author: Plautus

quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first  to get what you want  and after that to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: I am searching for that which every man seeks-peace and rest.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Reach high  for stars lie hidden in your soul. Dream deep  for every dream precedes the goal.
author: Pamela Vaull Starr

quote: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.
author: Georg Christoph Lichtenberg

quote: The one thing worth living for is to keep one's soul pure.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The greatest use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
author: William James

quote: How to make God laugh. Tell him your future plans.
author: Woody Allen

quote: God gives the milk but not the pail.
author: English proverb

quote: God Himself is not secure  having given man dominion over His work.
author: Helen Keller

quote: God is a circle whose centre is everywhere and circumference nowhere.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is not dead but alive and well and working on a much less ambitious project.
author: Graffiti

quote: God pays  but not weekly wages.
author: Polish proverb

quote: God seems to have the receiver off the hook.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: God uses lust to impel men to marry  ambition to office  avarice to earning  and fear to faith. God led me like an old blind goat.
author: Martin Luther

quote: God will provide - if only God would provide until he provides.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: God  when he makes the prophet  does not unmake the man.
author: John Locke

quote: He maketh his sun to rise on the evil and on the good  and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.
author: Jesus Christ

quote: I wouldn't put it past God to arrange a virgin birth if he wanted to  but I very much doubt if he would because it seems to be contrary to the way in which he deals with persons and brings his wonders out of natural personal relationships.
author: Right Rev. David Jenkins

quote: In the faces of men and women I see God and in my own face in the glass  I find letters from God dropt in the street  and every one is signed by God's name  and I leave them where they are  for I know that wheresoever I go others will punctually come for ever and ever.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The glory of God is in man fully alive.
author: St. Irenaeus

quote: The Vatican is against surrogate mothers. Good thing they didn't have that rule when Jesus was born.
author: Elayne Boosler

quote: The worst that you can say about him (God) is that basically he's an underachiever.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Though the mills of God grind slowly  yet they grind exceeding small  Though with patience He stands waiting  with exactness grinds he all.
author: Friedrich von Logau

quote: Try thyself first  and after call in God. For to the worker God himself lends aid.
author: Euripides

quote: By night an atheist half-believes in God.
author: Edward Young

quote: Father expected a good deal of God. He didn't actually accuse God of inefficiency  but when he prayed his tone was loud and angry  like that of a dissatisfied guest in a carelessly managed hotel.
author: Clarence Day

quote: Lord  who art always the same  give that I know myself  give that I know Thee.
author: St. Augustine

quote: We have no choice but to be guilty God is unthinkable if we are innocent.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: Man appoints  and God disappoints.
author: Cervantes

quote: I am afraid I shall not find Him  but I shall still look for Him. If He exists  He may be appreciative of my efforts.
author: Jules Renard

quote: God is not a cosmic bellboy for whom we can press a button to get things done.
author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

quote: God is usually on the side of big squadrons and against little ones.
author: Roger de Bussy-Rabutin

quote: The more of himself man attributes to God  the less he has left in himself.
author: Karl Marx

quote: God tempers the wind to the shorn lamb.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: God is a comedian whose audience is afraid to laugh.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Every man thinks God is on his side. The rich and powerful know he is.
author: Jean Anouilh

quote: I could prove God statistically.
author: George Gallup

quote: Man is a dog's ideal of what God should be.
author: Andri Malraux

quote: Christ - an anarchist who succeeded.
author: Axel Munthe

quote: An honest God is the noblest work of man.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: It is left only to God and to the angels to be lookers on.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God is really another artist. He invented the giraffe  the elephant and the cat. He has no real style. He just goes on trying other things.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The nearer the church  the further from God.
author: Bishop Lancelot Andrewes

quote: God'll send the bill to you.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: I believe there is no god but Allah alone and Muhammed is his prophet.
author: Muslim Creed

quote: The world is more exacting than God himself.
author: Yiddish proverb

quote: Give God time.
author: The Koran

quote: God will be present  whether asked or not.
author: Latin proverb

quote: If God did not exist  it would be necessary to invent him.
author: Voltaire

quote: We trust  sir  that God is on our side. It is more important to know that we are on God's side.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: I can't believe that God plays dice with the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: One on God's side is a majority.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: If triangles had a God  he would have three sides.
author: Baron de Montesquieu

quote: God does not pay weekly  but he pays at the end.
author: Dutch proverb

quote: The finding of God is the coming to one's own self.
author: Meher Baba

quote: God moves in a mysterious way His wonders to perform  He plants his footsteps in the sea And rides upon the storm.
author: William Cowper

quote: Man proposes  God disposes.
